Gets rid of Silverfish when breaking [#](bb00bb)Infested Blocks[#](), dropping double XP.\
\
Max Level: 1\
Applicable to mining tools.\
Mutually exclusive with Resonance.
book.spectrum.guidebook.razing.page0.tex:
Even with a list of enchantments that I can barely read anymore due to its length, there are still a few blocks that escape my gaze of superiority.\
\
[#](bb00bb)Obsidian[#](), you will be getting cancelled today.
book.spectrum.guidebook.razing.page1.tex:
Higher mining speed the harder a block is to break.\
\
Max Level: 3\
Applicable to mining tools.\
Mutually exclusive with Fortune.
There have always been blocks that I have been very interested in, but I have never been able to carve out of the ground carefully enough to retrieve them flawlessly. I've noticed, however, that these blocks vibrate in a similar way to the gems I've been so concerned with lately.\
If I can find the right frequency, I may finally be able to hold some of those blocks in my hands.
Uses gentle vibrations to drop some blocks as-is, preserve special properties, or turns them into something else entirely.\
\
Max Level: 1\
Applicable to mining tools.\
Mutually exclusive with Silk Touch, Fortune and Pest Control.
book.spectrum.guidebook.resonance.page12:
The gentle vibrations lull the silverfish hiding in the blocks.\
\
I can pack up the blocks including the Silverfish and take them with me, without them knowing what is happening to them.\
Sweet, sweet revenge.
The smaller gemstone buds are usually too fragile to be broken.\
\
However, with the right frequency, the small buds will break off the stone almost by themselves, as if I were using [#](449900)Silk Touch[#]().
Breaking [#](bb00bb)Ores[#]() with Resonance drops [Pure Resources](entry://ink/pure_resources) instead of Raw Ores.\
\
This would stack with Fortune... if I could somehow combine these two mutually exclusive enchantments.
Colored Leaves are stimulated to release many more [#](bb00bb)Saplings[#]().\
\
Applied to a hoe this will finally be my key to getting [Colored Saplings](entry://general/colored_trees) renewable.
In the depths, I have come across cages that seem to spit out an endless number of enemies. What madman put them there, what purpose they serve, and whether it was worth it with the poor loot is a mystery to me. But I can certainly find some use for them. Hopefully their creator won't miss me taking a few.
This immensely sturdy stone found in underground cities can be harvested.
Sculk Shriekers retain their ability to summon the Warden.
Brushable blocks retain their loot. I can brush them at home later.
book.spectrum.guidebook.serendipity_reel:
To be honest, I do not have to fishing any more to feed myself. Still a guilty pleasure of mine. Sitting at my pond and watching the soft waves makes me feel calm.\
Doesn't mean I don't appreciate the occasional catch. Or two. Or three. Or...

Chance to reel in double the loot. Or more!\
\
Max Level: 2\
Applicable to Spectrum's Fishing Rods.
book.spectrum.guidebook.sniper.page0.tex:
Compared to the [#](bb00bb)Bow[#](), the [#](bb00bb)Crossbow[#]() leads a rather inconspicuous existence.\
\
With the Sniping Enchantment however, the crossbow becomes a deadly ranged weapon.
book.spectrum.guidebook.sniper.page1.tex:
Increases damage, accuracy and projectile speed.\
\
Max Level: 2\
Applicable to Crossbows.\
Mutually exclusive with Multishot.
Knowing me, I will create the perfect tool, only to have it fall into Lava five minutes later in a moment of derangement. And then there is the dimension of the Endermen, which dramatically punishes any mistakes.\
\
This new enchantment will protect my favorite tools in case of brainfart (including being thrown against a cactus).
Protects tools from damage when on the ground, even from Lava or falling into the Void.\
\
Max Level: 1\
Applicable to all tools.
book.spectrum.guidebook.tight_grip.page0:
It almost seems like a fever dream when I remember being able to strike with weapons faster than I can think. Nowadays, each blow costs me so much energy that I have to pause for a moment.\
*Maybe I'm getting old.*\
\
With a few adjustments to my weapon, I can reduce this downtime somewhat.
book.spectrum.guidebook.tight_grip.page1:
Decreases attack cooldown.\
\
Max Level: 2\
Applicable to melee weapons.
I recently completed a painting, showing a fantastic creature that has appeared in my dreams: apparently made of [#](bb00bb)Soul Sand[#]() and [#](bb00bb)Wither Skeleton Skulls[#](). I waited in a Nether Fortress for hours, trying to recreate it, only to nearly lose my own head while searching for a Wither Skeleton with a spine loose enough to drop its skull. Heads up, I never were the one to bury my head in the sand.

Then I remembered the Creepers! After being struck by lightning, they explode wich such force that they blow their enemies' heads right off their necks (worst case: mine).\
To replicate this, I came up with an enchantment using [Storm Stones](entry://general/storm_stones).\
And so Treasure Hunter was born, allowing me to collect [all kinds of Mob Heads](entry://creating_life/mob_heads).

Occasionally drops Mob Heads on kill.\
\
Max Level: 3\
Applicable to axes and melee weapons.\
Mutually exclusive with Looting.
book.spectrum.guidebook.upgrading.text:
Upgrading from level I to level II is fairly cheap at first.\
This price will quickly increase to more and more [Pigment](entry://general/pigment) and experience for each additional level.
book.spectrum.guidebook.upgrading_enchan:
Enchantments and Color Magic have a lot in common. So I wasn't surprised when my first attempt to combine [#](bb00bb)Enchanted Books[#]() with [Pigment](entry://general/pigment) was an instant success.[#]()\
\
Placing an [#](bb00bb)Enchanted Book[#]() on the [Enchanter](entry://enchanting/enchanter), surrounding it with matching [Pigment](entry://general/pigment) and providing a steady stream of experience will raise the level of the book.
Interrupting said process will stop it entirely.
book.spectrum.guidebook.vanilla_enchantm:
The Enchanter is also able to create most enchantments I'm already familiar with.\
\
Those Enchantments can be upgraded to higher levels, too - using the same [Pigment](entry://general/pigment) used for creating it.
book.spectrum.guidebook.anvil_crushing.p:
*"To create something new\
you have to go the way of destruction"      - someone*

Until now you primarily used your anvil to repair and upgrade your tools. Such a heavy object as an anvil can be of much more use, though! Why not use it to crush things into dust by sheer force? Like the skulls of your enemies... or items. Yeah, that's probably better.\
\
You can use Item Crushing to crush [Gemstone Shards](entry://general/shards)[#]() into [powder](entry://general/gemstone_powder)[#]().\
\
*Tip: The further the anvil falls, the better.*
Dropping an [#](bb00bb)Anvil[#]() on some items cracks them, or turns them into different ones altogether.
You are also able to crush [#](bb00bb)flowers[#]() into [#](bb00bb)dye[#](), [#](bb00bb)Horse Armor[#]() into [#](bb00bb)ingots[#](), or increase your yield of [#](bb00bb)Blaze Powder[#]()this way.
book.spectrum.guidebook.artisans_atlas.p:
This map shifts and changes as I move, almost as if it were alive, sensing my intentions.\
Used in a structure, this atlas will guide me through treacherous terrain, across raging rivers and through dense forests to find similar structures.
book.spectrum.guidebook.ashen_circlet.pa:
The [Stratine Gem](entry://general/stratine)[#]() you set into this circlet, itself a creation of the Nether, can absorb high temperatures with ease.\
It even protects you from the blazing heat of Lava - if only for a short time.\
When paired with [#](449900)Fire Resistance[#](), you're able to swim in Lava almost as if it were Water.

- Prevents all damage from fires and hot floors
- Considerable boost in both mobility and vision when submerged in lava
- When triggered, grants you a brief shield against extreme heat
book.spectrum.guidebook.azure_dike_equip:
The results of combining [Azurite](entry://general/azurite) with the protective properties of [Blue Pigment](entry://general/pigment@blue) really sparked your interest. The material seemed to surround itself with a transparent aura which took some effort to penetrate when you reached for the lump.\
\
*This is going to be interesting...*

A magical aura surrounding your body, shielding you from incoming damage.\
Slowly but steadily recharges up to a specific amount.\
\
Each piece of Azure Dike Equipment increases the maximum amount of protection.

- Grants you [#](495b24)4[#]() points of [#](2c2e8e)Azure Dike[#]()
- Slightly speeds up [#](2c2e8e)Azure Dike[#]() charging

- Grants you [#](495b24)6[#]() points of [#](2c2e8e)Azure Dike[#]()
- Increases [#](2c2e8e)Azure Dike[#]() recovery after a hit, making it recharge quicker

Infuse it with [Blue Ink](entry://ink/ink) in a [Color Picker](entry://ink/color_picker)[#]() to increase the amount of [#](2c2e8e)Azure Dike[#]() provided.\
Cheap at first, but the required energy to infuse more power into this amulet increases exponentially.
book.spectrum.guidebook.azurite.name: Azurite
book.spectrum.guidebook.azurite.page0.te:
A rich blue ore that, at a distance I almost mistook for [#](bb00bb)Lapis[#](). In its natural form it contains many impurities that I must first remove before I can use it for most things.\
\
Found deep underground and seems to be able to intensify the energy of Pigment.
book.spectrum.guidebook.azurite.page1.te:
Refining Azurite is not a cheap task.\
In this refined form Azurite can be used for many more recipes.
book.spectrum.guidebook.bag_of_holding.p:
Placing an [#](bb00bb)Ender Chest[#](), opening it, and mining it with an enchanted pickaxe is not what I would call fun.\
That's why I made this thing.
All I have to do is open it and the contents of my [#](bb00bb)Ender Chest[#]() are right there.
book.spectrum.guidebook.base_trinkets.pa: These basic accessories are used as a base for more advanced Trinkets. All final Trinkets are created in the [Fusion Shrine](entry://general/fusion_shrine)[#]().
book.spectrum.guidebook.bedrock_anvil.pa:
I've used my anvil plenty (a lot of anvils, actually). [Item Crushing](entry://general/item_crushing), repairing and enchanting are burning a hole in my iron supply.\
To make the anvil last longer - indestructible, in fact - Bedrock seems like the perfect choice.\
It allows me to rename items for free and has no maximum repair limit.

It also allows me to add descriptions to my items.\
*Pro tip: "\n" will split the text into multiple lines.*
book.spectrum.guidebook.bedrock_armor.pa:
The strongest material you could find so far was Netherite. However, repairing [#](bb00bb)Netherite Armor[#]() had the disadvantage that it was more expensive than making the armor itself. In addition, the protection decreased with every scratch. All this is less problematic when the armor simply *cannot* be damaged.\
\
*Never wilt, stone blossom.*
The Bedrock Helmet comes with **Projectile Protection V**.
The Bedrock Chestplate comes with **Protection V**.
The Bedrock Leggings come with **Blast Protection V**.
The Bedrock Boots come with **Fire Protection V**.
book.spectrum.guidebook.bedrock_tools.pa:
Whenever you enter a new world you go about the mindless, days-long task of gathering villagers around you, turning them into zombies and healing them again, only for one of them to eventually hand you a book of [#](449900)Mending[#](). All this, just so you don't have to fix your tools.\
That's neither exciting nor species-appropriate. Now you have a much more convenient solution.
The Bedrock Pickaxe comes with **Silk Touch**.
The Bedrock Axe comes with **Efficiency VI**.
The Bedrock Shovel comes with **Efficiency VI**.
The Bedrock Sword comes with **Sharpness VI**.
The Bedrock Hoe comes with **Fortune IV**.
The Bedrock Bow comes with **Power VI**.
The Bedrock Crossbow comes with **Quick Charge IV**.
The Bedrock Shears come with **Efficiency VI**.
The Bedrock Fishing Rod comes with **Luck of the Sea IV**.
book.spectrum.guidebook.bismuth.name: Bismuth
book.spectrum.guidebook.bismuth.page0.te:
A metal that shimmers in all the colors of the rainbow.\
The little seedlings I collected are far too small to be of any meaningful use.\
\
How do I grow them without a budding block? One thing I noticed: they react to metallic blocks.
book.spectrum.guidebook.bismuth.page1.te: Instead of sacrificing entire blocks of metal, the [Crystallarieum](entry://ink/crystallarieum) provides a controlled substrate that serves as a more efficient way to deliver nutrients.
book.spectrum.guidebook.black_hole_chest:
The problem with hoppers is that they are not only slow, but their lack of range makes them ill-suited to larger farms.\
\
With a little Blue Pigment, all items within a wide radius of this chest-like mechanism can easily be brought to safety.
Radius of 12 blocks. Can be disabled by placing a solid block on top. Offers filters to specify which items it sucks in.
Putting a [Knowledge Gem](entry://enchanting/knowledge_gem) in a Black Hole Chest will allow it to absorb XP orbs, transferring the experience into the gem.
book.spectrum.guidebook.block_breaker.pa:
A simple but effective way of destroying blocks. Neither the most sophisticated nor the most customisable, but easy to set up and very compact.\
\
A Redstone signal causes it to destroy the block in front of it.
Can break blocks up to iron tier.
book.spectrum.guidebook.block_detector.p:
Similar to an [#](bb00bb)Observer[#](), but more specific.\
Gives off a [#](449900)redstone pulse[#]() each time a block is placed in front of it that matches the block below it (or above it, if facing down).
book.spectrum.guidebook.block_flooder.pa:
Like a caveman, I've always had to run around illuminating caves or closing their unsightly entrances in my immediate vicinity. To relieve myself of this task I took inspiration from the self-replicating abilities of [Fading](entry://general/fading) and developed the Block Flooder.\
Thrown into a narrow path, pond or ravine, those get filled with blocks - in 5%% of the time the result even looks acceptable!
Pulls matching blocks directly from my inventory to fill the gaps. If I don't have any matching ones, it falls back to Cobblestone.
book.spectrum.guidebook.block_placer.pag:
Automatically breaking blocks, weighing them, sorting them or putting them in one of my chests is easy. But there is one thing that all my previous machines could never do: Place things. That is now a thing of the past.\
[Topaz](entry://general/shards@topaz), with its affinity for matter, allows it to materialize blocks from its inventory.
book.spectrum.guidebook.blood_orchids.pa:
These leaves seem to belong to a flower I have never seen before. Did it bloom here once? Was it grown by those who came before me? Perhaps a souvenir from a world I do not even know exists? Yet it looks like as if it was plucked only five minutes ago.\
I feel something every time I touch the petal: *restlessness*.

[Resonant Lilies](entry://general/resonant_lily)! Truly an elusive flower - and apparently related to the Blood Orchid in some way (though the Blood Orchid's energy quickly takes over).\
Welp, what's the worst that can happen? Hopefully me ending up with another plant that I can pluck petals from.
book.spectrum.guidebook.bloodstone.name: Bloodstone
book.spectrum.guidebook.bloodstone.page0: The rather effulgent feathers of the [Kindlings](entry://creating_life/kindlings) are quite remarkable, so much so that I'm forced to give the little bumpkins coat trimmings on a regular basis.\\nHowever, I've noticed that the feathers are often accompanied by drops of blood. Dipped in [Liquid Crystal](entry://general/liquid_crystal), the feathers leave a glittering, crystalline residue.
book.spectrum.guidebook.bloodstone.page1: Placed in the [Crystallarieum](entry://ink/crystallarieum) and given a ***[#](ff3d71)precarious[#]()*** amount of [#](bb00bb)Copper[#](), the speck of dragonblood will grow and crystallize into a grand slab of glass, shining in stunning scarlet and bleeding with willful magic!
book.spectrum.guidebook.bottomless_bundl:
On my travels through the underground I collect a whole lot of mundane, identical blocks - which I will never need, but that's not the point! I am not a hoarder, *promise*.\
\
The Bottomless Bundle stores a virtually unlimited number of items, but only of one type.
Right-clicking it on stacks or empty slots in my inventory will fill / empty it.
Crouching places it down, making it possible to fill / empty it automatically.

A placed Bottomless Bundle will always remember the last item I put into it.\
Even if it is emptied it will only accept new items previously held, making it usable as a filter.\
\
*Note: If it is placed empty, it will accept the first item put into it and lock to that.*

Power increases its capacity tenfold per level.\
\
*That's a **lot** of storage. Can I completely fill one with Power V?*

Curse of the Void will void all items that would overfill the Bottomless Bundle.\
\
*No more useless blocks cluttering my path when mining.*
book.spectrum.guidebook.budding_onyx.pag:
Creating [Onyx](entry://general/onyx_shards)[#]() was always very tricky, as it depended on the current phase of the moon. Despite the [Crescent Clock](entry://equipment/crescent_clock) being a thing, you often missed that short time window.\
Making Onyx growable like the other gems will save you a huge amount of time.\
\
*Strangely, the same procedure does not seem to work for the other gems?*

Even if it seems expensive, having renewable Onyx seems worth it.\
\
Best to craft a larger batch of [Midnight Aberrations](entry://general/midnight_aberration) all at once, as they seem to crumble in your hands quickly.
book.spectrum.guidebook.celestial_pocket:
The problem with [Onyx Shards](entry://general/onyx_shards) is that their creation is tied to very specific conditions. A new moon does not happen every day. And, of course, every time I look at the clock, the window of time seems to have just passed by exactly a minute.\
Time to bring out the big guns: Magenta's affinity for time.
book.spectrum.guidebook.cinderhearth.pag: A state-of-my-art blast furnace that consumes [#](e16201)Orange Ink[#]() to smelt ores and the like.
Putting in a [Knowledge Gem](entry://enchanting/knowledge_gem) will funnel experience gained from smelting XP into it.
The Cinderhearth's abilities can be enhanced with [Upgrades](entry://magical_blocks/upgrades). They must be placed on the two Chiseled Blocks.

- 1 Cinderhearth
- 21 Polished Blocks
- 6 Crest Blocks
- 5 Glass-like Blocks
- 2 Chiseled Blocks
- 6 Buckets of Lava\
\
*Did it really need that [#](bb00bb)Lava[#]() underneath since you already have [#](e16201)Ink[#]()*? No, not really. But it looks so much better.*

[Upgrades](entry://magical_blocks/upgrades) placed on the [#](bb00bb)Chiseled Blocks[#]() require an additional type of [Ink](entry://ink/ink), depending on the type of Upgrade. The higher the upgrades level, the higher the consumption.

- Speed ([#](aa32a0)Magenta Ink[#]()):\
faster smelt times\

- Yield ([#](258ac8)Light Blue Ink[#]()):\
chance to multiply the output\

- Experience ([#](ff4ff6)Purple Ink[#]()):\
vastly increases experience gain\

- Efficiency ([#](302951)Black Ink[#]()):\
vastly decreased Ink consumption of other types, including [#](e16201)Orange[#]()
book.spectrum.guidebook.circlet_of_arrog:
That's it: Ascension - the ultimate buff - in wearable form.\
If your mere existence wasn't in danger every time you get hit too hard - a very expensive price to pay - you would not hesitate for a second to put it on.\
Should you really...?\
\
Of course.
book.spectrum.guidebook.clover.page0.tex:
Plains and other green biomes are home to these lush green clovers, sprouting with life.\
\
*Is today my lucky day?*
book.spectrum.guidebook.clover.page1.tex:
Indeed it is!\
I'm sure this tiny sign of luck will come in handy.
book.spectrum.guidebook.color_mixing.pag: By mixing [#](157687)Cyan[#](), [#](aa32a0)Magenta[#]() and [#](f0af15)Yellow[#]() (almost) any color can be created.

Your attempts to mix [Gemstone Powder](entry://general/gemstone_powder) directly have not been very successful. But now you have another idea:\
The closeness of your gemstones to nature suggests that *nature* must be both the source and the answer!\
\
You quickly scribble some notes, result being [a recipe](entry://general/colored_trees)[#](), which looks very promising.

You have tried and tried, to no avail. You could not find a way to create [#](613c20)brown[#]() by mixing your gem powder. The closest you came was a washed-out orange - ugh.\
It can't be that hard. Like... [#](613c20)Dirt is brown[#]() and it's the most common stuff around.\
\
There must be a way... \
and you're pretty sure [#](000000)Black[#]() is the answer.

\
\
\
\
\
\
\
*Seriously, look it up! The way we perceive brown is fascinating!*
book.spectrum.guidebook.color_mixing_bla:
\
\
\
The blackness of Onyx allows me a few more combinations. Still not perfect, but fantastic progress!\
\
What about grey tones? Maybe I'll come up with another idea...
book.spectrum.guidebook.color_mixing_whi:
\
\
**It's incredible!**\
\
Seeing the full colour spectrum after such a long, arduous journey and many failures makes my heart happy. I can't wait to see what creative innovations will flow through my brush next.
book.spectrum.guidebook.color_picker.pag:
Converts [Pigment](entry://general/pigment) into pure [Ink](entry://ink/ink).\
Fills Ink Containers, such as [Ink Flasks](entry://ink/ink_flask).\
Unfortunately - [because of the way Ink is transferred](entry://ink/ink@transfer) - there is always some left over. Kind of annoying... although I see some benefit in it, too: The bigger the difference between containers, the faster the transfer!
*Never develop a passion you can't afford. It'll eat away at your heart like a bookworm.*
book.spectrum.guidebook.colored_trees.pa:
You need something organic to mix your pigments. In your experiments, you could see that the roots of [#](bb00bb)Saplings[#]() absorb the color of the [Gemstone Powder](entry://general/gemstone_powder)[#]() with ease. Pure Color pulses through their tiny stems and first few leaves already.\
\
How will they look like when fully grown?

Creating a Colored Sapling requires a different combination of [Gemstone Powder](entry://general/gemstone_powder)[#](), corresponding to the [amount needed to mix its color](entry://general/color_mixing).
They existed around you all along! Who knows what else is out there.
Like their non-colorful, non-magical counterparts, you can also strip the logs and use their wood for Planks, Stairs, Slabs, Buttons, Pressure Plates, Fences and Fence Gates.
book.spectrum.guidebook.compacting_chest:
I have long since had enough of creating new storage space for all the coal, iron, copper and gold piling up in my storeroom. On that note I am also tired of crafting this stuff into more compact clumps...\
\
The Compacting Chest takes this monotonous work off my hands.

The name says it all:\
Crafts all the things in it using a 3x3, 2x2 or 1x1 pattern - able to be toggled in its GUI.
As the simplest of nodes the Connection Node has no active use.\
\
They solely act as a cheap and unobtrusive way of extending the reach of my networks.
Like all other nodes, the Connection Node has a range of 12 blocks.
book.spectrum.guidebook.constructors_sta:
I spend a lot of time placing blocks, so much so that I could almost believe that this is the main reason for my existence. But placing a lot of similar blocks is tedious.\
\
Or rather: *was* tedious.
When sneaking, expands based on all blocks instead of just matching ones.
book.spectrum.guidebook.cotton_cloud_boo:
To be able to fly like the birds has always been the dream of many people, including you.\
\
Now you have these boots. The freedom is almost overwhelming. You didn't get it quite right without a catch, but what can you do.

Small clouds form under your feet as soon as you start sprinting. Those clouds are too fuzzy to jump on, but safely levitate you in the air.\
\
There's just one kicker:\
*you better not stop sprinting high in the air*.
The Crafting Tablet is so much more than just a portable Crafting Table. It remembers the recipe I insert and lets me craft it on demand later.

There may come a time when I need a certain material so often that I want to automate it. Or maybe I will become one of those masochists who automates every single item just because I can.\
\
The [Pigment Pedestal](entry://general/pedestal) has a dedicated slot for a Crafting Tablet. If I add a Crafting Tablet and then hopper items into it, they will be placed as specified in the saved recipe.
book.spectrum.guidebook.crescent_clock.p:
This clock, made up of witnesses to time, is to guide me through this never-ending stream of beginnings and endings - the phases of the moon.\
\
\
\
*If we shadows have offended, Know but this and all is mended.*

*That you have but slumbered here, While these visions did appear.\
And this weak and idle theme, No more yielding, but a dream.*
book.spectrum.guidebook.crystal_apotheca:
Placed in [Geodes](entry://general/geodes), it automatically harvests fully grown [#](bb00bb)Gemstone Clusters[#]().\
\
Normally, all my other constructions and even crops freeze in time when I am far away, but this one seems to be an exception to that norm. Strange.
Although not as efficient as breaking clusters by hand, the ease of use is a definite plus.
book.spectrum.guidebook.crystallarieum.p: With budding blocks in mind, I designed an Ink-powered device that is able to grow chunks of raw ore into sparkling crystals. Though my best efforts at growing [gems](entry://general/shards) failed, I quickly realised that it could grow all sorts of other resources, when I throw them on it.

Growing resources requires:
- a starter bud thrown in
- catalysts thrown in
- a specific color of Ink, supplied via [Flask](entry://ink/ink_flask)[#]()

Each catalyst has a different effect on bud growth:\
while one catalyst may reduce the amount of ink required, another may alter the time required.

[#](449900)Metallic resources[#]() require unrefined materials such as [#](bb00bb)Raw Iron[#](), resulting in a [#](bb00bb)Small Iron Bud[#]() that will grow steadily until it can be safely harvested.\
\
For [#](449900)crystalline resources[#](), an existing crystal can be used as a seed to grow identical copies of itself.
book.spectrum.guidebook.draconic_twinswo:
What my musings have created here is nothing short of a masterpiece of versatility.\
This double-headed sword is exquisitely balanced, allowing for wide and powerful sweeping attacks. The delicate [Bloodstone](entry://creating_life/bloodstone) construction of the weapon makes it delightfully stalwart, and excellent at keeping an edge.

The [#](f0af15)Yellow Ink[#]() coursing through the sword allows me to throw it at extreme speed by hitting it after throwing it upwards. I catch it with a right-click - just have to watch out for the rebound.

The dynamism of this weapon goes on much further. If I switch hands while holding it while my other hand is empty, I can split the sword in two, resulting in a pair of twin daggers. Swift and deadly, these can also be thrown, though they work a little differently. Those same wisps of fluttering dandelion allow for nefarious mobility.

I can recall the daggers at will after throwing them - flinging me forward, or alternatively throwing the mobs they hit towards me. There are a lot of things that affect how and who moves, so I better play around with it a bit.

As a footnote, the weapon has some unique enchantment interactions.\
[Inertia](entry://enchanting/enchantments/inertia) boosts the Twinsword's strength each time it rebounds, while the talon's yoink on entities becomes stronger.\
[Improved Critical](entry://enchanting/enchantments/improved_critical) improves hits against airborne targets.\
Channeling improves sweeping and trades single-target ranged damage for AoE.\
Piercing does exactly what I would expect.

An unwelcoming, yet entrancing weapon.\
*I should try not to kill myself with it.*
book.spectrum.guidebook.dreamflayer.page:
A truly exceptional weapon, it embodies the definition of "offense is the best defense."\
It is the nature of the Dreamflayer to balance forces:\
The more armored your opponent is compared to you, the more damage it will do.[#]()\
\
Sneak-Use to empower it, allowing you to slice even through the strongest armor while consuming [#](8f2121)Red Ink[#]() at an alarming rate.

Requires night on a full moon.\
\
*If you ever needed a reason to go rampage lightly clad, here it is.*
book.spectrum.guidebook.enchantment_canv:
My pickaxe, which was sinfully expensive to enchant? It's almost broken, and each broken block now is more damaging to my nerves than the tool itself.\
Even if I can't save the tool, at least I can save the enchantments! This canvas does not capture color: When used on a tool, the enchantments are swapped.
Once used, an image of the item it was used on will manifest on the canvas, binding it to that type of item.
book.spectrum.guidebook.ender_dropper.pa:
The Ender Dropper is the counterpart to the [Ender Hopper](entry://magical_blocks/ender_hopper). On an [#](449900)redstone pulse[#]() it ejects an item from my [#](bb00bb)Ender Inventory[#]().\
\
Beware: Who's to stop someone from placing a button next to it and emptying it completely?. The counterpart to the [Ender Hopper](entry://magical_blocks/ender_hopper).
book.spectrum.guidebook.ender_glass.page:
I felt from the moment I put the recipe on paper that this creation was going to be something special.\
\
The combination of [#](449900)The End[#](), [#](449900)Redstone[#]() and [#](449900)Magic[#]() gives it very strange properties.

Depending on the strength of the applied [#](449900)redstone signal[#](), this block takes on different properties:
- Without redstone, it is completely solid
- a [#](449900)redstone signal[#]() makes it transparent, almost like glass
- however, it reaches its most curious state with full strength redstone signals...

To make it even stranger, the material seems to respond to the last signal applied, not the strongest.\
\
Truly a curiosity from the End.
book.spectrum.guidebook.ender_hopper.pag: Designed to resemble an ordinary hopper in form and function, the Ender Hopper has the special ability to put items directly into my [#](bb00bb)Ender Inventory[#](). The counterpart to the [Ender Dropper](entry://magical_blocks/ender_dropper).
book.spectrum.guidebook.ender_splice.pag:
Without a doubt, the most interesting thing about the Endermen is their teleportation ability. I was quite successful replicating it! However, in order to determine the destination of the teleport, I first have to take a snapshot of the position.\
Endermen don't have to do that, it seems. Why not? Or *do* they?

- When I first use it, it binds to my current position, the second use will teleport me back.
- Can even be used on other players
- Cannot teleport across dimensions
Unbreaking reduces the chance of it breaking on use.
Resonance will allow for inter-dimensional teleportation.
The gem built into the Entity Detector reacts to micro-vibrations in the ground. This gives it the ability to measure the number of creatures in its vicinity.
Outputs a cumulative strength of 1 for every creature within a 10 block radius.
book.spectrum.guidebook.everpromise_ribb:
A ribbon given to pets as an everlasting promise to watch over and care for them.\
I can name it and pin it on a creature. Should it ever die it will drop a [#](bb00bb)Broken Promise[#]().

My pet will immediately trust me, if it does not already. After naming it, I can use a [#](bb00bb)Crafting Table[#]() to add [Pigment](entry://general/pigment) to the [#](bb00bb)Ribbon[#]() to color the pets name.
book.spectrum.guidebook.exchanging_staff: For those of you who don't live in a simple [#](bb00bb)Cobblestone[#]() house, or live without walls entirely - I'm not writing about me, of course - I've come up with the Exchanging Staff, which can swap a whole bunch of connected blocks in the blink of an eye. Perfect for redecorating!
*Mining also just got a lot more fun*
Fortune allows multiplies ore drops when exchanging similar to using Fortune on a mining tool.
Silk Touch gives you the block exactly as it appeared in the world, without breaking the more fragile blocks such as glass or ore.
Resonance gives it the power to harvest some special blocks as they are.
book.spectrum.guidebook.fabrication_ches:
The Pigment Pedestal is wonderful for automatically creating items. But if I need the same few items over and over again, I'll have to rebuild my whole construction.\
\
Today I've found a more than adequate solution!

The Fabrication Chest has four slots for [Crafting Tablets](entry://equipment/crafting_tablet). The recipes I defined in them are always kept in stock - as long as the ingredients in the chest allow it.
book.spectrum.guidebook.fusion_shrine.pa:
To create [Black Shards](entry://general/onyx_shards)[#]() you have developed a special construction.\
You can either click or throw items and buckets onto it. You can even process entire stacks of fusion ingredients at once, making fusing much more efficient than using a single item per cycle. Very useful for recipes that require [good timing](entry://general/onyx_shards)[#]().

Can be constructed using [#](bb00bb)Calcite[#]() or [#](bb00bb)Basalt[#]().\
Requires a focus structure and clear view of the sky.

- 1 Fusion Shrine
- 4 Polished Gemstone Blocks
- 4 Chiseled Polished Blocks
- 8 Polished Pillars
- 12 Polished Slabs
- 77 Polished Blocks\
\
As always you are able to switch [#](bb00bb)Basalt[#]() with [#](bb00bb)Calcite[#]() and choose the [Gemstone Blocks](entry://decoration/gemstone_storage_blocks) to your liking.

You have designed the structure for the Fusion Shrine to bundle the magical energies of [#](157687)Matter[#](), [#](aa32a0)Time[#]() and [#](f0af15)Energy[#]() and focus them on a single, central point, the Fusion Shrine itself.\
\
These powerful bundled energies seem to even have enough power to change the weather.

*It's a brand new day\
And the sun is high\
All the birds are singing\
That you're gonna die*

*Knock Knock\
Who's there?\
Accordion\
Accordion who?\
Accordion to the forecast, it's going to rain tonight.*

*Why did the god of thunder drink water?\
\
Because he was thorsty.*
book.spectrum.guidebook.garland_of_tranq:
The idea of being left alone is great! What isn't so great is having my tongue go numb from drinking leaf juice every fifteen minutes. The solution to my problems is self evident, simply wear the nightdew!... and pump it full of purple ink.\
\
*Wait - since this is made from the flowers, does that make it a lei?*

Infuse it with [Purple Ink](entry://ink/ink) in a [Color Picker](entry://ink/color_picker)[#]() to increase your stealth.\
\
*~The sleep resistance is complimentary~*
book.spectrum.guidebook.gather_node.name: Gather Node
book.spectrum.guidebook.gather_node.page:
The Gather Node will actively request items from other nodes and put them in the connected inventory.\
\
Specify the items to be collected in its [#](449900)filter[#]().
book.spectrum.guidebook.gemstone_armor.p:
You had more than enough time to develop your own individual fighting style.\
To best support this style, you've designed a range of matching gear out of interesting materials.\
\
Disadvantage: The shards used in the production are kind of brittle. Therefore, this equipment has a comparatively low durability.

They can be repaired in Anvils by using [Gemstone Shards](entry://general/shards)[#]().\
\
To take advantage of their unique abilities you will need some special materials:
Gives attackers Weakness and Slowness when they hit you, letting you slip through their claws like a shadow.
Grants Absorption and Resistance when you get hit, making you a massive wall for a short duration.
Gives you a short burst of Regeneration on hit, making you get right back up, ready to strike back.
Gives a short burst of Speed and Invisibility when you get hit, giving you an opportunity to retreat. Perfect for ranged combat.
Most recipes in your pedestal require some amount of Gemstone Powder as a source of magical energy.\
It comes in various colors and can be acquired by pulverizing [Gemstone Shards](entry://general/shards)[#]() via [Item Crushing](entry://general/item_crushing)[#]().

There is nothing more important to an upcoming artist than mixing the right paint.\
Unfortunately, you found that in the case of Gemstone Powder, it's not nearly as easy as it initially seemed. The powders don't quite want to mix, the result being just a multicolored mass.\
\
Maybe you can come up with something later?
$(item)Gemstone Powder$() can be compacted for storage or decoration.
book.spectrum.guidebook.geodes.name: Geodes
book.spectrum.guidebook.geodes.page0.tex: Geodes form in places where magical energy is so abundant, that it physically crystallizes.
book.spectrum.guidebook.geodes.page1.tex:
Breaking Clusters gives me Gemstone Shards, which seem to inherit most of the original magical properties.\
Each type of gem seems to represent a different type of fundamental property.\
\
Different heights encourage the formation of certain types. To find them all, it will make sense to search in different places.
book.spectrum.guidebook.geodes.page2.tex: The precious gems are protected by layers of [#](bb00bb)Calcite[#]() and [#](bb00bb)Basalt[#]().
book.spectrum.guidebook.geodes.page3.tex:
Now that I'm paying attention, I notice small inclusions of gems in the rock all over the place.\
If I see such an ore a geode is surely not far!\
\
While not renewable like Gemstone Clusters, Gemstone Ore yields a lot of shards, especially if broken with a Fortune tool.
book.spectrum.guidebook.geodes.page4.tex: Topaz geodes are gigantic compared other geodes - fitting considering their element of Matter. They are found exclusively high up in mountains and massive hills.
book.spectrum.guidebook.geodes.page5.tex:
As elements of time, Amethyst Geodes tend to maintain their existence in the deepest layers of the world, quietly sealed off from all the other happenings of the world.\
Leisurely yet imposing.
book.spectrum.guidebook.geodes.page6.tex: Citrine Geodes are found in the middle layers of the world, sometimes even accessible from the surface. These geodes are small, but harbor tremendous energy. No wonder I found them to be particularly prone to having cracks.
book.spectrum.guidebook.geodes.page7.tex:
In the Deeper Down I stumbled upon Moonstone Geodes! I always suspected that this variant *must* exist in some form.\
\
These majestic geodes shine in the brightest of whites. Almost blinding, when accustomed to the darkness of the Deeper Down.
book.spectrum.guidebook.glass_arrows.pag: These razor-sharp arrows deal increased damage, can be fired underwater and can pierce translucent blocks such as [#](bb00bb)Glass[#]().
Also pulls the target in your direction, ready to be dealt a deadly melee hit.
Also freezes the target, slowing them down and dealing freezing damage over time.
Also hits your foe with enormous force, knocking them far away.
Deals damage regardless of the target's invincibility frames and resets them. Deals additional damage to shields.
Explodes in an orb of pure energy, dealing damage to creatures close by.
book.spectrum.guidebook.glass_crest_tool: Socketing [Moonstone Cores](entry://dimension/moonstone_cores) into your [Malachite Tools](entry://dimension/malachite_tools) grants them powerful new abilities.
Shoots out [#](d0d6d7)White Ink[#]() which will break blocks on impact. You can also choose from [Resonance](entry://enchanting/enchantments/resonance) when switching enchantments.

Deals a chunk of its damage via [#](449900)Magic[#](), which pierces armor. Use to charge a [#](449900)ground slam[#](), knocking back everything around you. This ability scales with [#](449900)Sweeping[#]()).
If an arrow is loaded, you can overcharge the shot by holding sneak+use to increase your shot's accuracy, speed and damage even further.

The result of combining a Bident and a Pocket Thunderstorm. Hurl yourself into the air and damage everything in your path, even in the driest of deserts! ...as long as you don't run out of ink (scales with the level of Riptide). *Flying isn't the problem. Landing is.*

The [#](bb00bb)Echo Shards[#]() make this Bident throw an echo of itself when thrown that shatters upon impact - the original will never leave your hand.\
\
*The fractal may be empowered with efficiency and power, improving yield and damage.*
book.spectrum.guidebook.gleaming_pin.pag:
During your explorations you were hit by arrows again and again, only to completely miss your enemy while looking around in panic - if it hadn't already disappeared behind the next corner already.\
When you get hit, the Gleaming Pin emits a magic surge that passes through walls and attaches to nearby creatures so you can easily track them down.
Enchanting the Gleaming Pin with Sniping allows the surge to pierce even more matter, further increasing its range.
book.spectrum.guidebook.glistering_melon:
I [managed to transform seedlings](entry://general/colored_trees), so what's stopping me from trying it on other plants?\
Not because I'm a bit greedy or anything, of course. Pure interest.
book.spectrum.guidebook.gloves_of_dawns_:
When you asked your neighbor what this [#](bb00bb)"Gobber"[#]() was that they were always talking about, the only answer you got was that this godlike material was "out of reach for you, little artist".\
Before they could explain to you that "out of reach" was not to be taken literally, you had already designed these gloves. Oops.

Oh, well, now that you've thought them up, you're gonna use them!\
\
Infuse them with [Light Blue Ink](entry://ink/ink) to increase the additional reach provided.
book.spectrum.guidebook.glow_vision_gogg:
What makes Glow Squids so special is them lighting your way in the darkness of the caves. As beautiful as they are, they seem to wash ashore far too often and meet their sad end there.\
You honor their clumsy glowing legacy by designing glasses that can continue guiding you in the darkness of the caves.
If you are in a dark area and have Glow Ink Sacs on you, the Glow Vision Goggles grant you the Night Vision effect.
book.spectrum.guidebook.greater_potion_p:
Works very much like its [little brother](entry://brewing/lesser_potion_pendant).\
However, this version has three chambers, each of which can be filled with a different potion - which also means it can only support effects of level I.
book.spectrum.guidebook.heartbound_chest:
I often find myself placing down a box to store my belongings, only to return to find everything looted.\
This special chest can even help me protect by stuff as well as catch the thief red-handed.
Can only be opened by the person who placed it, and has the same space as two mundane chests.

Similar to a Trapped Chest it emits a [#](449900)redstone signal[#]().\
If I, as the owner, open it, the signal strength will be full; if a stranger tries to tamper with my belongings then only half.
book.spectrum.guidebook.heartsingers_rew: This dainty ring has it all: with the help of a little (or a lot!) of [#](d6658f)Pink Ink[#](), it strengthens you from the inside out and grants you additional hearts.
Infuse it with [Pink Ink](entry://ink/ink) in a [Color Picker](entry://ink/color_picker)[#]() to increase the amount of extra hearts provided.
book.spectrum.guidebook.hints.amethyst.p: There is a type of geode found deep underground.
book.spectrum.guidebook.hints.azurite.pa: There is a new blue ore that can be found in all biomes on the Overworld.
This rich blue ore generates very deep underground and is quite rare.
book.spectrum.guidebook.hints.citrine.pa: There is one type of geode that is commonly found near the surface. It is most likely to be found exposed in lakes or ravines.
book.spectrum.guidebook.hints.clover.pag: Search for a Plains biome. You might get lucky!

Clovers grow in small patches in Plains biomes, most of them with three leaves, but some with four. You can tell a Four-Leaved Clover from a three-leaved one in its block shape already. They can be spread using Bonemeal or the Nature's Staff.
book.spectrum.guidebook.hints.downstone_: The deeper you dig into the underground of the Deeper Down, the more often you will come across rocks that seem indestructible. At this level, there is a structure to be discovered.

Near the lowest levels of the Deeper Down, you will sometimes come across structures used by the former inhabitants to carve this stone. Inside one of the chests in this structure you will find a new resource.
book.spectrum.guidebook.hints.dragonbone: In Dragonrot Swamps, you can find the remains of giant creatures. These blocks seem to be impossible to mine in the traditional way, since they are protected by a magical aura. Is there an unconventional way to break this aura, perhaps using great force?

The magical aura of Dragonbone Blocks can be breached using powerful explosions. You will need something with a bit more explosive power than TNT, such as Incandescent Amalgam. Powerful magical explosions have the same effect.
book.spectrum.guidebook.hints.fading.pag: Fading is a small and weak organism that feeds on organic blocks placed next to it. Right-click the bottle to place it as a block; you can bottle them again by using an empty bottle.

Place organic blocks such as Leaves, Pumpkins or Melons next to a Block of Fading and wait a while. The block will be consumed and replaced by a different looking one. Break this converted block to get a new resource.
book.spectrum.guidebook.hints.failing.pa: Just like Fading, they prefer a specific block placed next to them. Much stronger this time, though. 'I hate mining this'-strong, to be precise.
Their favorite food is Obsidian. But beware of their insatiable hunger. They will eat a lot if given the chance...
There is a new ore that can be found in the Deeper Down.
It is bright green and can be found in the deepest parts of Deeper Down. It's not often found exposed to the air, so the best way to get it is by branch mining.
book.spectrum.guidebook.hints.mermaids_g: Sometimes shiny gems can be found in oceans, floating on the surface and tossed around by the waves. If you spend some time near or in an ocean, you might find one yourself!

The source of these gems is a coral-like plant that grows in small groups on the seabed, disguised as sea grass. Wait besides it or bone meal it and it will release its precious treasure. After you collect one, you will be able to see the plant for what it is.
book.spectrum.guidebook.hints.midnight_c: This liquid, created during the creation of the Midnight Aberration... it damages every creature it touches.

Midnight Solution has different effects depending on what lands in it. Enchanted items lose their magical powers, some items change completely, and creatures killed by it drop a small, mysterious fragment.
book.spectrum.guidebook.hints.moonstone_: The lower plains of the Deeper Down appear to have once been home to a highly advanced civilisation.
Some of the cities left behind house a heavily guarded structure. Their protectors appear to be mechanical and very unfriendly, powered by delicate magitech.
book.spectrum.guidebook.hints.name: Progression Hints
book.spectrum.guidebook.hints.nightdew_s: There is something fragrant in the soil, but you can't quite nail down its location. Surely, a keener sense of smell would help here.
The dormant sprigs of an unusual vine are scattered in the soil beneath your feet. While they are too delicate and elusive for you to dig up, a Sniffer would be naturally suited to the task.
A turquoise ore can  be found in the End.
This ore can be found both on the central island and in the outer regions of the End. It generates exposed to air just rarely. It has a common and a rare drop. Catch it before it's too late!
book.spectrum.guidebook.hints.preservati: There are three different types of impenetrable structures hidden near the beginning of the Deepslate layer in the Overworld in every biome. They appear to be made of an unbreakable stone.

The entrance seems to be blocked by a powerful force field. However, whoever built it was kind enough to leave you some clues! The hearts on the sides of the force field indicate that you need to have Azure Dike active.
The Colored Spore Blossoms on the ceiling and the engravings on the walls behind them hint at the solution. A powder engraving and a '? + ?'. You have to mix Gemstone Powder.

Is there a way to crack the Bedrock? Once you are inside, it is best to look at the relevant pages in your book for the blocks you find there. Another tip: It is always good to have some dyes with you.
book.spectrum.guidebook.hints.quitoxic_r: Time for an adventure trip on the surface. Visit a Swamp or Mangrove Swamp!
Strange-looking plants have been seen in all sorts of swamps, growing on patches of Clay or Mud. In order to grow, they consume Clay/Mud placed around them, turning it into Dirt.
book.spectrum.guidebook.hints.radiating_: Not every block carried by an Enderman is what it seems at first glance.

Some Endermen will appear carrying blocks that could very well be small relics of the End itself. You can get one by killing an Endermen while it is carrying something that looks like Cobblestone. Endermen holding these blocks can also be found in the End, albeit more rarely.
book.spectrum.guidebook.hints.resonance_: Between lakes of Liquid Crystal, you can often find crystalline structures made up of blocks that take on interesting properties when interacted with.

Hummingstones, part of crystal formations in the Crystal Gardens biome, begin to vibrate when disturbed, causing other nearby Hummingstones in their vicinity vibrate as well. The more stones there are, the stronger the echo will be.
book.spectrum.guidebook.hints.resonant_l: In [Crystal Gardens](entry://dimension/crystal_gardens), flowers that grow near [Liquid Crystal](entry://general/liquid_crystal) have strange characteristics. Has their proximity to the liquid changed them?.
I don't have that much time to grow a whole new plant like that. But what if I simply throw an existing plant into the liquid to speed up the process?
book.spectrum.guidebook.hints.ruin.name: Experiment #3
book.spectrum.guidebook.hints.ruin.page0: This absolutely aggressive version called Ruin is capable of consuming the most resistant material there is. Even one too resistant for you to ever break before.
book.spectrum.guidebook.hints.ruin.page1: What could be more resilient than the unbreakable Bedrock floor itself? Better have some Decay Away up your sleeve a backup plan in case things get out of hand.
book.spectrum.guidebook.hints.shimmersto: There is an ore in the Overworld at and above surface level.
It generates in large deposits in all biomes in the middle and upper layers of the Overworld. It is most commonly found exposed in mountains.
book.spectrum.guidebook.hints.stargazing: Shooting Stars only appear at night. Having something to help you see them in the dark will certainly help. They produce a noticeable particle trail.

Your best chance of seeing a Shooting Star is to look for it with Night Vision and a Spyglass. If you see one crashing down, try following its path to find out where it landed. They shoot particles up in a beam-like shape.
book.spectrum.guidebook.hints.storm_ston: Thunderstorms are a powerful display of nature. Enormous energies are at play.
Sometimes you can find strange shards at places where lightning has struck. There is even a vanilla way to focus lightning on a specific location, to make collecting it even more efficient.
book.spectrum.guidebook.hints.stratine.p: There is a red ore in the Nether.
It can be found in the lower layers of the Nether in all biomes below lava level. It has a common and a rare drop.
book.spectrum.guidebook.hints.topaz.page: This type of geode is found at great heights, typically on top of hills and sky-high mountains.
book.spectrum.guidebook.hoverblock.page0: Created from a collision of [Stratine](entry://general/stratine) and [Paltaeria](entry://general/paltaeria), this block just... floats around, vibing.
book.spectrum.guidebook.hoverblock.page1:
...well, most other placed blocks seem to be able to float in the air without support just fine for whatever reason, too, but this one is special: [#](449900)it retains any momentum I give it[#](), like when using a [#](bb00bb)Piston[#](), even if I stand on it.\
\
Sneak+Use to pick it up again.
book.spectrum.guidebook.idols.name: Idols
book.spectrum.guidebook.idols.page0.text:
Manifestations of a creature in block form.\
\
Using them, walking on them, or hitting them with a projectile triggers an action specifically associated with that creature.
book.spectrum.guidebook.idols.page1.text: Gives a short burst of Regeneration.
book.spectrum.guidebook.idols.page10.tex: Teleports to a random position up to 16 block away.
book.spectrum.guidebook.idols.page11.tex: Teleports to another Jagged Idol in a straight line up to 16 blocks away.
book.spectrum.guidebook.idols.page13.tex: Gives a short burst of Water Breathing.
book.spectrum.guidebook.idols.page14.tex: Gives a short burst of Haste.
book.spectrum.guidebook.idols.page16.tex: Gives a short burst of Glowing.
book.spectrum.guidebook.idols.page18.tex: Gives a short burst Mining Fatigue.
book.spectrum.guidebook.idols.page19.tex: Gives a short burst of Strength.
book.spectrum.guidebook.idols.page2.text: Echolocates creatures within an 8 blocks radius.
book.spectrum.guidebook.idols.page20.tex: Gives a short burst of Invisibility.
book.spectrum.guidebook.idols.page21.tex: Gives a short burst of Night Vision.
book.spectrum.guidebook.idols.page22.tex: Gives a short burst of Absorption.
book.spectrum.guidebook.idols.page23.tex:
Causes Insomnia.\
When in open sky, a player will immediately get haunted by a [#](449900)Phantom[#]().
book.spectrum.guidebook.idols.page24.tex: Feeds animals in a 6 block radius using food lying around.
book.spectrum.guidebook.idols.page26.tex: Freezes blocks around it (freezing [#](bb00bb)Water[#]() to [#](bb00bb)Ice[#](), cooling [#](bb00bb)Lava[#]() to [#](bb00bb)Obsidian[#](), ...).
book.spectrum.guidebook.idols.page27.tex: Gives a short burst of Nausea.
book.spectrum.guidebook.idols.page28.tex: Gives a short burst of Jump Boost.
book.spectrum.guidebook.idols.page29.tex: Shears creatures in a 6 block radius.
book.spectrum.guidebook.idols.page30.tex: Gives a short burst of Levitation.
book.spectrum.guidebook.idols.page31.tex: Invades blocks next to it with Silverfish.
book.spectrum.guidebook.idols.page33.tex: Increases the size of Slimes in a 6 block radius.
book.spectrum.guidebook.idols.page35.tex: Gives a short burst of Poison.
book.spectrum.guidebook.idols.page36.tex: Gives a short burst of Blindness.
book.spectrum.guidebook.idols.page37.tex: Gives a short burst of Slowness.
book.spectrum.guidebook.idols.page38.tex: Gives a short burst of Fire Resistance.
book.spectrum.guidebook.idols.page39.tex: Gives a short burst of Resistance.
book.spectrum.guidebook.idols.page4.text:
Smelts ore, and other blocks, such as [#](bb00bb)Netherrack[#]() to [#](bb00bb)Magma Blocks[#](), ...)\
Also sets fire to the creature that triggered it and any nearby blocks.
book.spectrum.guidebook.idols.page40.tex: Gives a short burst of Weakness.
book.spectrum.guidebook.idols.page42.tex: Gives a short burst of Wither.
book.spectrum.guidebook.idols.page5.text: Negates all fall damage when landed upon. Also resets fall damage when hit.
book.spectrum.guidebook.idols.page6.text: Gives a short burst of Slow Falling.
book.spectrum.guidebook.idols.page7.text: Milks all Cows, Goats and Mooshrooms in a 6 block radius.
book.spectrum.guidebook.incandescent_ama:
*The sun on the palm of my hand* sounded far better in theory. \
\
Now that it sits there... well, it burns. The very fact that it exists is almost a miracle - really, it should have exploded in the barrel - an unstable, simmering amalgam of ethanol blended with a cocktail of accelerants that hates existing.

One false move could easily cause it to detonate, taking everything nearby with it, including me. And yet, for all these reasons and more, the soft, warm glow of the gel elicits endless curiosity. All things are drawn to the flame. There is no question that what is effectively a high-yield magical explosive bears endless potential. All I need is a little care, a small mountain of it, and a touch of reckless abandon.
The longer the synthesis goes on, the higher the yield... I really can't blame the angels for not wanting their share of this.
The amalgam's pristine burn makes it uniquely suited to Pure Alcohol distillation
book.spectrum.guidebook.ink.name: Ink
book.spectrum.guidebook.ink.page0.text:
Now that I'm familiar with [Pigment](entry://general/pigment), I see no reason to lug it around like in the Middle Ages. I have found a way to convert [Pigment](entry://general/pigment) into a higher form of energy!\
\
I called it [#](5bffed)I[#](aa32a0)n[#](eded00)k[#]().
book.spectrum.guidebook.ink.page1.text:
[Pigment](entry://general/pigment) can be converted to Ink using the [Color Picker](entry://ink/color_picker) and then extracted into containers like an [Ink Flask](entry://ink/ink_flask).\
\
The only drawback: deprived of its physical form, there is no way to reverse this transformation.
book.spectrum.guidebook.ink.page1.title: Producing & Storing
book.spectrum.guidebook.ink.page2.text: Ink behaves a bit like gas. It flows from where it is abundant to where there is little.
book.spectrum.guidebook.ink.page2.title: Transfer
book.spectrum.guidebook.ink.page3.text:
\
When two objects that store Ink are connected - like when putting in an [Ink Flask](entry://ink/ink_flask) into a [Color Picker](entry://ink/color_picker) - the Ink between the two will slowly equalize.\
The larger the difference, the faster the Flask is filled.
book.spectrum.guidebook.ink_assortment.p: This collection of small vials allows me to store all kinds of [Ink](entry://ink/ink), albeit only small amounts of each.
The Ink Flask holds a considerable amount of [Ink](entry://ink/ink) of each color.
I can fill it in the [Color Picker](entry://ink/color_picker).
book.spectrum.guidebook.intro.name: Intro
book.spectrum.guidebook.intro.descriptio: About the mod and how to get started
book.spectrum.guidebook.intro.page0.text: Spectrum is a progression and exploration-driven magic mod where you combine colors.
book.spectrum.guidebook.intro.page1.text:
You will be tinkering with color mixing in the subtractive color system (CMYK). You may be familiar with subtractive color mixing from watercolor painting or printing.\
\
The main colors of the spectrum are represented with gemstones, you can find in geodes scattered around the world, with the vanilla Amethyst representing Magenta.
book.spectrum.guidebook.intro.page2.text:
Spectrum features a unique progression system where you unlock new things as you progress.\
As you progress, you will notice changes in the world. Differences that only *you* personally can perceive.\
\
Everything you learn will bring you closer to your ultimate goal: To find out what lies beneath the impenetrable bedrock floor.
book.spectrum.guidebook.intro.page3.text:
No idea on how to progress? Take a look at this book or your advancements. These give a lot of hints on what to do next. Press the bottom center arrow to get started!\
\
Spectrum is still in development. If you find a bug or have a suggestion, visit Spectrum's Discord or report them on GitHub.\
Have fun!        - DaFuqs
book.spectrum.guidebook.item_detector.pa:
The Item Detector is used to count items lying on the ground within a 10 block radius.\
\
The strength of the [#](449900)redstone signal[#]() depends on how many items are lying around.
64 items result in a maximum strength signal.
book.spectrum.guidebook.jade_vines.page0:
The remaining energy of this plant from eons ago is barely still perceptible. So featherweight and fragile that I feel any false move could breathe the last bit of life out of this fragile bulb.\
\
*Will the history of this plant remain elusive to me forever?*
book.spectrum.guidebook.jade_vines.page1:
Once almost a lost cause, I now have an ace up my sleeve:\
With the help of the [Spirit Instiller](entry://creating_life/spirit_instiller) I'm sure I can breathe some life back into the little deadish bulb.
book.spectrum.guidebook.jade_vines.page2:
Pallid, fragile but beautiful hanging plants, twining down wooden fences with generous space underneath.\
[#](8f2121)Not used to intense light after all these eons, they will die if exposed to too much sunlight.\
[#](5faa19)They only grow one stage a night and only when exposed to the much softer, indirect light of the moon.
book.spectrum.guidebook.jade_vines.page3:
As I exposed one of the plants to strong sunlight, I found that it had withered. Not only did this withered shrub leave me now only with new Bulbs, but also with this gel-like jelly, though!\
\
*Unexpectedly tasty*.
book.spectrum.guidebook.jade_vines.page4:
When Jade Jelly is heated blazingly fast and then cooled down again, the result is a very viscous but sugar-sweet mass.\
\
*Fancy a sugar rush?*
book.spectrum.guidebook.jade_vines.page5:
Shiny petals can be plucked when partially grown.\
They can be used for decoration.\
Rarely, I can find [#](449900)another Bulb[#]() when searching through the petals. What will Jade Vines look like when I let them grow further, tough?
book.spectrum.guidebook.jade_vines.page6:
After many full moon nights, the plants reach full bloom. I was able to gather collect some nectar from their blossoms by using a [#](bb00bb)Glass Bottle[#]().\
Bears great restorative properties:
- can be drunk for healing
- able to repair any damaged item.
book.spectrum.guidebook.jeopardant.page0:
Adrenaline does not have to be the only thing racing through your veins in a state of emergency.\
\
With every heart lost, the [Stratine Gem](entry://general/stratine)[#]() in this ring shines brighter and brighter, pulsating in the same rhythm as your racing heart - granting you an exponential damage boost.
book.spectrum.guidebook.jeopardant.page1:
*Tell me what you think about your situation\
Complication, aggravation*
book.spectrum.guidebook.knowledge_gem.pa:
Picking up one of those little green orbs that appear whenever I kill an enemy makes me smarter - supposedly.\
\
However, inevitable death by clumsiness means that I always quickls lose this experience again. Crystallized and safely stored in my chest, however, it will be as safe as can be.
Holds up to 10,000 experience. [Enchanting](entry://enchanting/enchanting_items) it with [#](449900)Efficiency[#]() increases this limit, [#](449900)Quick Charge[#]() boosts the transfer speed of XP.
Putting a Knowledge Gem in a [Black Hole Chest](entry://magical_blocks/black_hole_chest) will allow it to absorb XP orbs and store the experience in the gem.
book.spectrum.guidebook.lagoon_rod.page0:
On quiet days on your patio you could observe that marine life seems oddly attracted to the [Mermaid's Gems](entry://general/mermaids_brush)[#]() you found. Since they naturally float on water, you decided to use one as a bobber.\
\
Lo and behold, not only does it increase your success, but also has quite a few other interesting side effects...
book.spectrum.guidebook.lagoon_rod.page1: *You wonder what you can bring to the surface?*
book.spectrum.guidebook.lava_sponge.page:
When I held a [#](bb00bb)Wet Sponge[#]() in my hands, I thought naturally there must be a counterpart for [#](bb00bb)Lava[#](), too. Although I haven't stumbled upon one yet, that hasn't stopped me from inventing one.\
\
This should make navigating the depths of the world and beyond that hellish portal much easier.

...or so I thought, until I realized that the lava-soaked sponge also has an *unfortunate* side effect.\
I should have guessed.
The Lava Sponge can be used as highly efficient fuel in the [#](bb00bb)Furnace[#](), drying in the process.
book.spectrum.guidebook.lesser_potion_pe:
Potions are handy. Carrying half an inventory of them around, however, is more than a little inconvenient.\
The Potion Pendant has a small chamber that can be filled with the effect of a potion. As long as you wear it, you will receive the effects of that potion.\
Since the potions are not ingested, the effects will only last up to level III.
book.spectrum.guidebook.light_level_dete:
[#](bb00bb)Daylight Detectors[#]() are imprecise when it comes to measuring light: the [#](bb00bb)Nether Quartz[#]() they use is so crudely processed that only sunlight can reliably trigger it.\
Amethyst is much more sensitive when it comes to measuring light. Even the dim glow of a [#](bb00bb)Torch[#]() is enough produce a decent reading.
The Light Level Detector responds not only to sunlight, but also to other light sources, such as light-emitting blocks.
book.spectrum.guidebook.liquid_crystal.p: The pure energy of gems in liquid form. Seems to have a healing effect.
Combined with various other liquids results, it produces materials with interesting properties.

Letting Liquid Crystal collide with [Liquid Mud](entry://magical_blocks/mud)[#]() created [#](bb00bb)Clay[#]()! Surely there are more combinations to be discovered!\
\
*Thomas had never seen such an imbalance before.*

Allowing an entire block of Liquid Crystal to absorb the immense heat of Lava resulted in this.\
Almost feels like a [#](bb00bb)Magma Block[#](), albeit way hotter.

When [#](bb00bb)Water[#]() flowed into a full block of Liquid Crystal, the crystal solidified.\
Since even the slightest touch was enough to give me a cold shiver, I named it Frostbite Crystal.
This is an interesting one. When [#](bb00bb)Flowers[#]() absorb this magical liquid through their roots, they turn into those elusive plants.
book.spectrum.guidebook.liquid_crystal_e:
Allowing an entire block of [Liquid Crystal](entry://general/liquid_crystal) to absorb the immense heat of [#](bb00bb)Lava[#]() resulted in this.\
Almost feels like a [#](bb00bb)Magma Block[#](), albeit way hotter.

[Crushing](entry://general/item_crushing) [#](bb00bb)Blazing Crystal[#]() with an [#](bb00bb)Anvil[#](), gave me this searing hot essence that almost sets my hand on fire when I touch it. Crushing [#](bb00bb)Magma Blocks[#]() also seems to work, albeit with far less yield.

When [#](bb00bb)Water[#]() touched a source block of [Liquid Crystal](entry://general/liquid_crystal), the crystal turned solid.\
Since even a light touch is enough to give me a cold shiver, I fittingly named it Frostbite Crystal.

[Crushing](entry://general/item_crushing) [#](bb00bb)Frostbite Crystal[#]() with an [#](bb00bb)Anvil[#]() gave me this ice-cold essence that almost freezes my hand just by holding it. Crushing [#](bb00bb)Ice[#]() also seems to work, too, albeit with far less yield.
book.spectrum.guidebook.malachite.name: Malachite
A pristine material that sparkles in a deep green hue. It seems to have strong magical properties, almost like a Deeper Down analog of [Azurite](entry://general/azurite). In another similarity to [Azurite](entry://general/azurite), Malachite also needs to be refined. I first have to grow the small fragments I found into full, usable crystals - though I'm not sure I'll see them fully grown in my lifetime, since I didn't find a budding block for them.
The [Crystallarieum](entry://ink/crystallarieum) seems to be the only way for me to grow Malachite, as it serves as a budding block alternative. I found [Moonstone](entry://general/moonstone_shards) to be a prerequisite, as it creates an environment mimicking the Deeper Down.
[Malachite](entry://dimension/malachite)[#]() as a material seems perfect for tools, best compared to [#](bb00bb)Diamond[#](), but much easier to combine with other materials.\
These combinations are where the fun begins, allowing for some uniquely intricate tools.

The perfect [Multitool](entry://equipment/tools_and_armor/multitool)[#]():\
Sneak+Use allows you to switch between [#](449900)Silk Touch[#]() and [#](449900)Fortune[#](), mining large tunnels at once and allows you to [#](449900)strip[#](), [#](449900)till[#]() and [#](449900)flatten[#]().

Its sheer size allows you to hit enemies from a greater distance.\
If you hadn't included the [Paltaeria](entry://general/paltaeria)[#](), you probably wouldn't even be able to lift it.

A true powerhouse when dealing with aquatic creatures.\
\
*It may have only two prongs compared to a [#](bb00bb)Trident[#]()*, but they are twice as pointy!*
Shoots projectiles at a higher speed and precision compared to a mundane [#](bb00bb)Crossbow[#]().
book.spectrum.guidebook.mermaids_brush.p:
Mermaid's Brushes are an inconspicuous plant I found growing in the deepest depths of oceans, forever untouched by human influence.\
\
They grow a single blossom, which slowly develops into a pearl-shaped seed. When fully grown, these hollow seeds float to the surface to be carried away by the waves.

These seeds can be planted to grow another plant.\
\
Mermaid's Gems have a strong bond with water - obviously.
book.spectrum.guidebook.midnight_aberrat:
The results of my [last experiment](entry://general/failing) make me long for more: how much power can I squeeze out of these gemstones?\
I am sure there's more, and [Neolith](entry://general/neolith) must will be my entry gate! With such coherence, it may allow me to unite the powers of all the gems into one. This relic shall be the capstone to my creation, my personal Philosopher's stone, making me a living god!

Requires daytime and a clear sky.\
\
The fusion of these magical energies will stress my Fusion Shrine like nothing before - with a display to match. Best to make sure it and the blocks around it are fortified and isolated.

*This abomination of a gemstone radiates an eerie aura.*\
\
It looks loosely connected at best. No wonder it falls apart in my hands in no time. Total failure. Diary, I am both *devastated* and disappointed in myself.

While the chaos that ensued was *definitely* not the result I craved for, the result does indeed hold immense power.\
So much so that it will crumble to dust if not used quickly.\
\
And then there is that aggressive blackish fluid that manifested in the process. Because of its color I named it [Midnight Solution](entry://general/midnight_solution).
book.spectrum.guidebook.midnight_solutio:
This bizarre liquid is a direct result of [my failed fusion experiment](entry://general/midnight_aberration)[#](). Pity, really, but look what I have now.\
Creatures that touch it seem to have their lives sucked out of them. Interesting...\
Better not get caught in it myself.

Creatures that die in Midnight Solution drop a small splinter almost resembling [Midnight Aberration](entry://general/midnight_aberration), only much, much smaller, sharp-edged, and vicious.\
Creatures unalived by this gruesome process also seem to [#](449900)drop items as if they were killed by a player[#]().
The very drop I get from killing creatures with this feisty liquid enables me to make even more of it. Quite morbid, when I think about it.
A seemingly useless block that forms around pools of Midnight Solution.
Throwing some items into the liquid seems to corrupt them to the point where they change into something else entirely.
When I throw enchanted items into it, they will lose their special abilities. All that's left is the normal item and a bunch of experience.
"Any technology advanced enough is indistinguishable from magic," I once heard.\
I'm still not entirely sure how this system manages to store so many blocks in such a small space, but since I regularly walk around with hundreds of square metres of dirt, I've never bothered to question it.
Looks like the [#](bb00bb)Crystal Growth Accelerator[#]() can speed up the growth of all kinds of Gemstone Buds!
The [Crystal Apothecary](entry://ink/crystal_apothecary) is able to harvest [#](bb00bb)Certus Quartz[#]().
Tools enchanted with [Resonance](entry://enchanting/enchantments/resonance) are able to harvest [#](bb00bb)Budding Quartz[#](), they even retain their *flawless* state.

Many of AE2's items can be [crushed to dust with an anvil](entry://general/item_crushing): [#](bb00bb)Certus Quartz[#](), [#](bb00bb)Fluix[#](), [#](bb00bb)Skystone[#]() and [#](bb00bb)Ender Pearls[#]().
In desperate need of [#](bb00bb)Charged Certus Quartz[#]()? [Storm Stones](entry://general/storm_stones) will charge them up in a heartbeat.
...and then create [#](bb00bb)Fluix[#]() out of it, if I get impatient.
As crystalline structures, [#](bb00bb)Certus Quartz[#]() and [#](bb00bb)Fluix Crystals[#]() can be grown in the [Crystallarieum](entry://ink/crystallarieum).
Rock Crystal is a great source of Silicon

Hardened by heat and pressure, beautiful Alloy Forges can be made from calcite and basalt.\
\
Perhaps I will even find more minerals to use on my next adventure. Best to write them all down here.

In addition, some items can be used as special fuel for Alloy Forges, and some ores have increased output when smelted in one.\
\
Tell Noaaan I said hi!
A high-end forge that melts at an incomparable temperature. Low capacity.
An exceptional forge that uses extra pressure to speed up the melting process. Holds a reasonable amount of fuel.
Pure Resources get a nice multiplier when turned into their mundane counterpart.
With a high tier [#](449900)Alloy Forge[#]() I can squeeze quite a bit more [Stratine](entry://general/stratine) out of the raw ore.
...same is true for its sister ore [Paltaeria](entry://general/paltaeria), of course.
A dripping [#](bb00bb)Lava Sponge[#]() contains enough heat to power an Alloy Forge for quite some time.
Also a good heat source for my Alloy Forges.
Quite slow, but packs a *lot* of fuel.
Twice as fast as the Basalt variant, but I have to refuel quite more often.
A high-tier Forge with medium speed and fuel capacity.
A high-end forge with incredible capacity and reasonable smelting speed.
I recently found new materials scattered across the landscape in new, beautiful terrain. I'm sure I can use them in some interesting way.
The [Crystal Apothecary](entry://ink/crystal_apothecary) is capable of harvesting [#](bb00bb)Illunite Shards[#]().
I found an abundance of colorful flowers growing in small patches in forests and plains! What's up with those? Definitely worth a look tinkering with them and train my brown thumb.
Crushing the flowers may seem a bit unorthodox, but it *did* work. No problem plucking the petals from the flattened blossom afterwards.

- +3 positive effects
- 50%% chance for negative effect
- makes the potion unidentifiable.\
\
*Do I fancy a gamble?*

- +3 potency
- -3 yield\
\
Requires other reagents to increase the yield, otherwise I will end up with nothing...

- +25%% duration
- 15%% chance to add last effect

- creates Lingering Potions & Tipped Arrows
- -25%% potency

Having studied color theory as well as botany, I can definitely see some similarities. The colored flowers, resemble [Colored Trees](entry://general/colored_trees) in more than just one way.\
\
No wonder their petals make a great source of [Ink](entry://ink/ink).
Constructors and Exchanging Staffs are able to pull blocks out of my Black Hole Talisman.
Adding some [Shimmerstone](entry://general/shimmerstone) to magical flowers will make them glimmer.
Applying [Pigment](entry://general/pigment) to mushrooms will color them in the respective color.
Using [Pigment](entry://general/pigment) instead of [#](bb00bb)Dye[#]() when crafting [#](bb00bb)Floral Fertilizer[#]() is quite a bit more yielding.
The [#](bb00bb)Black Lotus[#]() is a great source of Mana, no questions asked. However, it can be improved with some [#](449900)Jade Petals[#]().
Those elusive seeds I could only find in chests hidden across the world? Expensive - maybe not even worth the hassle - but I finally found a way to reproduce them.
I can finally harvest Enchanted Soil! [Resonance](entry://enchanting/enchantments/resonance) is the key.

- +2 positive effects
- +1 negative effect
- makes the potion unidentifiable.\
\
*Do I fancy a gamble?*

Getting lost deep down time and time again has made me carry a bit of [#](bb00bb)Chalk[#]() at all times, allowing me to mark the way back out. Unfortunately these little pieces of Calcite never last long before they break.
By using [Pigment](entry://general/pigment) instead of Dye, the [#](bb00bb)Chalk[#]() provides me with a never-ending supply of markings.
Of course I was able to make [#](bb00bb)Glow Chalk[#]() unbreakable, too.
Oh yeah, *colored* chalk! Of course I haven't forgotten you.

*Souls, Spirits, Cages*\
Now if that isn't a work of shrewd occultism I don't know what is.

Distilled Spirits can be...\
umm... distilled?\
*distilled further?*\
into long-lasting [#](449900)Resistance[#]() Potions.

I'm not even sure how I came up with this recipe anymore.\
Maybe I inhaled a little too much [#](bb00bb)Quitoxic Powder[#]() when combining various ingredients. But the result is interesting, no doubt.

Combining everything I learned as a Spawner expert and Pigment Tinkerer, I was finally able to create my own [#](bb00bb)Mob Spawners[#]()!\
I only need to assign a creature to spawn using the [Spirit Instiller](entry://creating_life/spirit_instiller).

Everywhere it rattles and fizzles, whistles and smokes. An ensemble of assemblage.\
\
Surely some of these machines will come in handy.
[#](bb00bb)Colored Leaves[#]() can be crushed, yielding [Pigment](entry://general/pigment) and a higher chance for [#](bb00bb)Colored Saplings[#]().
[Quitoxic Reeds](entry://general/quitoxic_reeds) can be milled into powder.
Milling [Frostbite Crystal](entry://general/crystallisation) will yield a nice amount of [#](bb00bb)Frostbite Essence[#]().
Milling [Blazing Crystal](entry://general/crystallisation) will yield a nice amount of [#](bb00bb)Incandescent Essence[#]().

New biomes bring new opportunities. But which ones?\
*Time to find out!*
To an ignoramus, an alchemist might well be mistaken for a magician. Time to get to know the differences - but also the similarities.
This material seems ridiculously powerful for how common it is. That's why I gave it such a funny name. Let's see what I can do with it.
You are not going to believe this, but...

My magical fishing rods allow me to fish lava and end dwelling fish, like the Go Fish fishing rods.\
I can also fish Crates, as long as I am in the open.

While the Deepfry Enchantment cooks fish as usual, I have not found a way to attach lures to rods made with Pigment. However, I am sure I will find a way to enhance these rod later by other means.\
Deepfry on Fishing Rods is mutually exclusive with Foundry.

Unlike my other gems, [#](bb00bb)Amethyst[#]() seems to have the ability to power spell casting wands. While this ability has broken my brain on more than one occasion, the results are impressive.\
What else is there?
Hexcasters are seemingly unable to identify minerals other than Amethyst. *Clearly* these cyan-colored leaves have the essence of [#](bb00bb)Topaz[#]()...

By infusing [#](bb00bb)Leaves[#]() with [#](bb00bb)Amethyst[#](), [#](bb00bb)Citrine[#]() or [#](bb00bb)Topaz[#](), I get out glistening, colorful [#](bb00bb)Gemstone Leaves[#](). Intriguingly different, yet familiar to my [Colored Trees](entry://general/colored_trees).
I can charge up [#](bb00bb)Amethyst Shards[#]() using the [Fusion Shrine](entry://general/fusion_shrine).

- +15-120s duration. Sometimes more, sometimes less\
\
