As I expected, [#](bb00bb)Charged Amethyst[#]() serves as a more potent, but also more fluctuate, [#](bb00bb)Amethyst[#]() reagent in regards to prolonging durations.

These industrious little buggers continuously collect leaves from trees. The results of their work are reflected in their products. While they mainly produce [#](449900)Clay[#](), there may be others...\
\
Shout out to MastroCaleb for this great mod!
The ants produce an almost silk-like material from [#](bb00bb)Jade Petals[#]().
If I shovel a full anthill that has collected leaves from colored trees, I get [#](bb00bb)Dye[#]().
Even better, if I bribe them with [#](449900)Vegetal[#](), I can get pure [#](449900)Pigment[#]() instead.
Scattered around the world I discovered numerous geodes, which produce valuable resources.

I am an advancement hunter with style!\
\
With Paginated Advancements, Spectrum's advancements use new, unique frames.
Marks the start and end of an advancement tree: important milestones in my journey.

Advancements that use this slightly modified frame have some sort of unlock attached to them: new recipes, a new revelation or something else. (for all you completitions out there!)\
\
Advancements without additional unlocks use the default frame instead.
Indicates that there is a new structure I have to build.
For affairs of heart, which require an extraordinary eye for detail.

Granted for doing something remarkably stupid.\
These are purely optional meme advancements with no unlocks.

Above the hemisphere of the Overworld exists a very different kind of dimension: filled with numerous spheres that float like small planets.\
\
I can reach them by building a portal from [#](bb00bb)Packed Ice[#]() (if it hasn't been changed by the modpack).

There I can find numerous resources that are hard to come by in the Overworld: Geode Spheres, Spectrum's ores, and anything else my heart desires - unless I fall off a planet and plummet to my certain death.
Modular tools were always a field I was interested in. Let's see what I can come up with to make my life easier.
The [Crystal Apothecary](entry://ink/crystal_apothecary)[#]() is able to harvest [#](bb00bb)Crystals[#]() automatically - even if you are not near those geodes at all!
Tools enchanted with [Resonance](entry://enchanting/enchantments/resonance)[#]() are able to harvest Budding Blocks.

There is this new thing, called *Electricity*, I should check that out.\
\
The factory must grow.
The Cinderhearth is great at creating Refined Iron! What a little more heat can do.
I can process most of my magical ores in the Grinder and Industrial Grinder.

Of course I can also grind down Shards, too!\
\
*I hate grind in games*

*Still mining each ore individually? Gravity might make it easier.*\
\
Vein Mining rips out all connected blocks.\
\
Max Level: 1\
Applicable to all tools.
I took heart... and another and another. Now I've got a whole bunch of them. Exciting, huh.
book.spectrum.guidebook.modular_explosiv:
Highly modular explosives, consisting of:
- an [#](449900)Archetype[#]() (damage entities, destroy blocks, both, or just purely cosmetic)
- and [#](449900)Modifiers[#]() (change the damage type, lighting fire, increased blast radius, damage and much more)

The [Pigment Pedestal](entry://general/pedestal)[#]() can combine a Modular Explosive with items that specify Archetype and Modifiers.\
\
I can customize an entire stack of explosives in one go.

A magical mine that, once placed, primes after a few seconds and explodes on contact, dealing a massive amount of damage. A [Midnight Chip](entry://general/midnight_solution@midnight_chip) disarms it for safe dismantling.
A multi-purpose explosive, that can be placed on walls and detonated, as well as thrown. Harmless to living beings by default.

- Gunpowder: Destroying Blocks
- Glowstone Dust: Dealing Damage
- Midnight Aberration: Both\
\
I can also combine both separately.

- TNT: Increased radius
- Chorus Fruit: Starry Particles
- Shimmerstone: Placement of invisible lights

- Fire Charge: Fire
- Doombloom Seed: Primordial Fire
- Storm Stone: Lightning Damage
- Neolith: Magic Damage
- Incandescent Amalgam: Incandescent Damage
- End Rod: Greatly increased damage when near the explosion center

- Stratine Fragments: Square block breaking shape
- Four Leaf Clover: Fortune
- Mermaids Gem: Silk Touch
- Ender Pearl: Inventory Insertion

Modular Explosives come with a suitable archetype built-in. However, if I want to change that, I can use the [Pigment Pedestal](entry://general/pedestal)[#]() to [#](449900)clear Archetype and Modifiers[#]() and start from with a clean slate.
book.spectrum.guidebook.molten_rod.page0:
Orange, representing warmth, can be used to do the most interesting things.\
\
Unlike a normal [#](bb00bb)Fishing Rod[#](), this one is a lot more sturdy and is able to fish where a common rod fails.\
You wonder what you can bring to the surface?
book.spectrum.guidebook.molten_rod.page1:
*Caution, hot!*\
Its flaming fishing hook can burn more than just your fingers...
This powerhouse of an item is capable pf channeling huge amounts of [#](d0d6d7)Ink[#]() with ease. Can be used to enhance the capabilities of equipment and devices.\
\
*A relic of times long past*.
book.spectrum.guidebook.moonstone_shards:
I was quite simple-minded not so long ago, wasn't I? Thought I knew everything, but that everything was always merely half the truth.\
\
I know better now. This white, pure gem in my hand, shimmering with a soft, warm glow, is a monument to my personal growth.

I have never been remotely omnipotent, never will be. Not with all the magic in the world. Nobody is. But with a little humility, care and support, I can at least get a little closer.\
\
**[#](d0d6d7)Purity.**
book.spectrum.guidebook.mud.page0.text: Mud. It is wet mud. Not particularly interesting in itself. What is useful is the collision of Liquid Mud with other liquids, such as [#](bb00bb)Water[#]() or [#](bb00bb)Lava[#](). This will create [#](bb00bb)Dirt[#]() or [#](bb00bb)Coarse Dirt[#](), respectively.
book.spectrum.guidebook.mud.page1.text: *While a mud bath sounds like wellness, it is not advised. Believe me, I tried.*
book.spectrum.guidebook.mud.page2.text:
Some items that come into contact with Mud will tan.\
For example, [#](bb00bb)Rotten Flesh[#]() will turn into to a small piece of [#](bb00bb)Hide[#]().
book.spectrum.guidebook.mud.page3.title: Tanning Rotten Flesh
Whenever you leave your home, you carry half a tool shed with you. Given the tons of stone you can carry around with you, that's almost nothing. Nevertheless, a universal tool that combines the abilities of a pickaxe, axe, shovel and hoe would suit you well.
*Not as efficient in the individual tasks, but much better than having to change tools every three seconds.*
book.spectrum.guidebook.mysterious_locke:
I found this mysterious Locket in a Preservation Chest. It is locked tightly. It has a stange ornament that resembles a notch, softly glowing a pale white color, a shimmer reminiscent of the moon.\
There seems to be something inside. It also has an engraving on its back, but if it resembles a language it's not one I've ever seen.\
What is it for? Who did it belong to? Why was it there?
I noticed that the notch seems to fit perfectly with a [Moonstone Core](entry://dimension/moonstone_cores).

The locket contained a small crystal, bearing a dim, yet warm glow.\
While [below the Bedrock](entry://dimension/delving_deeper_down), it vibrates softly as I turn.
There also was a little note inside... who could it have belonged to?

Now that I understand the Dreiton language, it is easy for me to decipher the inscription on the back:\
\
*Don't be silly, Asteras - the moon cannot shine, it can only reflect the light of the sun.*
book.spectrum.guidebook.natures_staff.pa:
Using the elements of [#](613c20)Nature[#]() and [#](5faa19)Fertility[#](), I have come up with this stroke of genius.\
#](bb00bb)B[#]() is a joke in comparison.
*Point at something you want to see blossom*
[#](449900)Efficiency[#]() decreases the chance of [Vegetal](entry://general/fading@vegetal) getting consumed.
book.spectrum.guidebook.nectardew_burgeo:
It is natural enough that Nightdew can flower. I did not, however, expect its flower to be... like *this*. The soothing essence of the plant's sprigs has blossomed into a bouquet of sleep magic, deep alike a sea of which I may well be diving too deep. \
\
*...oh, that isn't a friend...*

The rarity of these burgeons has proved to be a problem. There is a solution to that though. The plants are a lot more eager to bloom when sleeping creatures are near...\
This is wrong right? Not the sleep but... something like this *cannot* come by on its own. The roots of this magic run too deep, unto things hidden beneath the water's surface.
book.spectrum.guidebook.night_salts.page:
As much as I would like to work day and night, sleep is ultimately a necessity, and one I have done a poor job of managing. The long nights that accompany discovery and exploration can be really hard on the mind.\
\
\
*Phantoms make sure that it is also rough on the body, too.*

These vials should solve all my problems. One good whiff of the salts inside should knock me out in 10 seconds flat.\
\
*Does this smell like chlorophorm to you?~*
A curious little sprig reminiscent of tea leaves! Its extracts are pleasantly sweet and ripe with calming qualities. Only thing is that I just can't seem to figure out where to plant it on.\
\
*~ A fragrant little friend ~*
Ahhh. After a lot of careful observation, the way to cultivate these has finally revealed itself to me. These vines are picky, and will only grow on certain natural blocks endemic to the deep.
book.spectrum.guidebook.nightfalls_blade:
This small blade is too fine to inflict serious wounds, but has many sharp spikes that drill themselves into the flesh of your opponent.\
\
Infused in the [Potion Workshop](entry://brewing/potion_workshop)[#](), all struck opponents are afflicted with the effect - provided you have enough [Ink](entry://ink/ink)[#]() on you.
book.spectrum.guidebook.omni_accelerator:
When you came up with its name, you really meant it.\
The Omni-Accelerator is loaded with items or blocks and can shoot them at a distance.\
Blocks are placed and the poor thing that gets hit by your flying items receives its effects. All it needed was a powerful energy source in the form of a [Moonstone Core](entry://dimension/moonstone_cores)[#]().
Sharp Dripstone is not the only thing that can be used as a projectile. There are some... *interesting*... things you can do with this fun toy if you load it correctly.
book.spectrum.guidebook.only_works_when_: Only works while its owner is online.
book.spectrum.guidebook.onyx_shards.name: Creating Onyx Shards
book.spectrum.guidebook.onyx_shards.page:
For Brown Pigment I need to darken Orange.\
DARK! It's so logical now that I think about it! The three gems I found correspond to the three basic colors of color theory!\
By mixing all three, I can create a shard that is so dark it looks almost unreal.

I will have to create the 'blackest of blacks' in the [Fusion Shrine](entry://general/fusion_shrine) in a way that absolutely no unregulated light can contaminate the crystal. So midnight on a new moon it is. Best to bring a clock.
Depending on the position of the sun and moon, the moon reflects more or less light.

These are known as [#](449900)Moon Phases[#]().\
\
When the moon is at its brightest, it is called a [#](449900)Full Moon[#](). When at its darkest it is called a [#](449900)New Moon[#]().\
\
An entire lunar phase cycle from one new moon to the next is also called a [#](449900)lunation[#]().
book.spectrum.guidebook.paintbrush.page0:
Why a *brush* of all things?\
\
Good question, I wondered that myself, after I came up with it. It was mostly intuition, really. There is something about the colorful Pedestal and the bright colors of the crystals that awakened something I now call my inner artist.
book.spectrum.guidebook.paintbrush.page1: Giving the [Pigment Pedestal](entry://general/pedestal) a good whack with it will make it start crafting.
book.spectrum.guidebook.paintbrush.page2:
What better use is there for [Pigment](entry://general/pigment) than to color with it?\
If I [#](449900)crouch with my Paintbrush equipped I can bring up the color selection menu[#](). All I have to do is slightly touch a block I want to color and the [Pigment](entry://general/pigment) will to flow into it and change it to that new color.
book.spectrum.guidebook.paintbrush.page3:
I can use my brush to bundle up Ink and fling it as a projectile.\
The surface (or creature!) the projectile hits will be painted as long as it can be recolored, plus dealing a good amount of knockback.
book.spectrum.guidebook.paltaeria.name: Paltaeria
The pale blue color is the hallmark of this ore, found exclusively in small clusters in the End.\
\
Like the End itself, the curious properties of this material are not to be overlooked.
From my previous experience with Paltaeria, I can already guess that it would not be a good idea to place this block outdoors - my future self will thank me.
book.spectrum.guidebook.pastel_network.p:
My primitive methods of transporting items, such as [#](449900)Hopper Arrays[#]() do not compare to the [#](449900)Pastel Network[#]() - this is what I named clusters of Azurite-based nodes.\
Placed in close proximity, the nodes will connect wirelessly to one another and form a transfer network.
The way nodes can interact with each other. They do not require line of sight.
book.spectrum.guidebook.pedestal.page0.t:
Look at this beautiful thing. Inspired by the gem I found. This enhanced [#](bb00bb)Crafting Table[#]() allows me to use [Gemstone Powder](entry://general/gemstone_powder) to create entirely new blocks never seen before.\
\
To make it start crafting I need to trigger it with a [Paintbrush](entry://general/paintbrush) or a [#](449900)redstone signal[#]().\
It requires air or an inventory above it.
book.spectrum.guidebook.pedestal.page1.t:
\
Most recipes require [Gemstone Powder](entry://general/gemstone_powder) as a catalyst.\
\
Since the Pedestal resembles a [#](bb00bb)Crafting Table[#](), it can also be used to craft vanilla recipes.\
\
Can be automated using a [Crafting Tablet](entry://equipment/crafting_tablet).
book.spectrum.guidebook.pedestal.page2.t:
\
For the design, I can use the gem of my choice.\
\
While they look different they are functionally the same.
book.spectrum.guidebook.pedestal_customi: I can exchange the basalt blocks with calcite and choose the gemstone blocks as I like it best. By mixing [#](bb00bb)Calcite[#]() and [#](bb00bb)Basalt[#]() I can give the structure my own personal touch.
book.spectrum.guidebook.pedestal_upgrade: Pedestal CMY Upgrade

I now have three gems. *And an idea*!\
Instead of using just one for my [Pigment Pedestal](entry://general/pedestal), I should upgrade it with all three types of shard. This will make it both prettier and more versatile.
CMY Variant

In order to use the advanced abilities of the [Pigment Pedestal](entry://general/pedestal) I will need a structure to focus energy into it.\
\
I call it the **Spectrum Focus**.
Pedestal Structure
Dimensions: 11x11x4 blocks. But best to leave a few extra blocks of space around, just in case.

- 1 Pigment Pedestal
- 4 Polished Gemstone Blocks
- 4 Chiseled Polished Blocks
- 4 Notched Polished Blocks
- 8 Polished Pillars
- 68 Polished Blocks
Dimensions: 13x13x7 blocks
Moonstone Pedestal
I can upgrade my [Pigment Pedestal](entry://general/pedestal) by using a [Moonstone Shard](entry://general/shards@moonstone).

- 1 Pigment Pedestal
- 4 Onyx Chiseled Blocks
- 4 Notched Polished Blocks
- 8 Gemstone Lamps
- 4 Gemstone Chiseled Blocks
- 12 Polished Gemstone Blocks
- 16 CMYK Chiseled Blocks
- 36 Polished Pillars
- 52 Polished Crests
- 172 Polished Blocks

- 4 Onyx Chiseled Blocks
- 4 Polished Gemstone Blocks
- 36 Polished Crests
- 12 Polished Blocks
Moonstone Pedestal (2)

My latest structure feels... somewhat lacking. And now I know exactly what is missing: more [#](d0d6d7)Moonstone[#](). The tricky part: To create the required [#](bb00bb)Moonstone Chiseled Blocks[#]() would need to be able to use the full capabilities of my [#](bb00bb)Moonstone Pedestal[#]() already, but without the finished structure I can't use Moonstone Powder yet.\
*Could there be a way around this? A kickstart, if you will?*

- 1 Pigment Pedestal
- 4 Onyx Chiseled Blocks
- 4 Notched Polished Blocks
- 8 Gemstone Lamps
- 4 Gemstone Chiseled Blocks
- 12 Polished Gemstone Blocks
- 16 CMY Gemstone Chiseled Bl.
- 28 Moonstone Chiseled Bl.
- 36 Polished Pillars
- 52 Polished Crests
- 144 Polished Blocks
- 28 Moonstone Chiseled Bl.
Pedestal Onyx Upgrade
I can upgrade my [Pigment Pedestal](entry://general/pedestal) by using an [Onyx Shards](entry://general/shards@onyx) to further increase its magical power.
Onyx Variant
Dimensions: 13x13x6 blocks

- 1 Pigment Pedestal
- 8 Polished Gemstone Blocks
- 8 Gemstone Lamps
- 4 Chiseled Polished Blocks
- 16 Gemstone Chiseled Blocks
- 16 Polished Crests
- 4 Notched Polished Blocks
- 36 Polished Pillars
- 160 Polished Blocks

- 4 Polished Gemstone Blocks
- 8 Gemstone Lamps
- 16 Gemstone Chiseled Blocks
- 16 Polished Crests
- 28 Polished Pillars
- 92 Polished Blocks
book.spectrum.guidebook.perturbed_eye.pa:
Every time I want to enter the realm of the Endermen, I have to travel half a world. Whoever created the portals to the End... I'm so much more knowledgeable than they are now.\
\
Well, almost.\
I still haven't figured out how to create such portals myself, but packing them up and taking them home? *No problem.*
The End Portal, like found in Strongholds
Due to the extremely sturdy portal frames, these have to be quite destructive. Best to keep a bit of distance after socketing.
All I have to do is put the portal back together the way it was, re-add Eyes of Ender, and done!
book.spectrum.guidebook.pigment.name: Pigments
book.spectrum.guidebook.pigment.page0.te:
Finally! I was able to obtain absolutely pure Pigment! I harvested it from the leaves of a [Colored Tree](entry://general/colored_trees), today.\
And by using a hoe the harvest is pretty fast, too.\
These Pigments have a magical feel to them.\
\
I'm still not fully convinced that all colors even exist in this form.
book.spectrum.guidebook.pigment.page1.te: A hypothetical list. How many can I find?
book.spectrum.guidebook.pigment.page10.t:
This juicy lime almost smells like a warm spring morning. Or is it just my imagination?\
\
[#](5faa19)Lime[#]() represents *Happiness* and *Fertility*.
book.spectrum.guidebook.pigment.page11.t:
Soft magenta always puts me in a calm and contented, almost serene mood.\
\
[#](aa32a0)Magenta[#]() represents *Time*, *Kindness* and *Tolerance*.
book.spectrum.guidebook.pigment.page12.t:
This orange color reminds me of autumn. Makes me feel a bit like sitting in a comfy armchair in front of a fireplace.\
\
[#](e16201)Orange[#]() represents *Warmth* and *Comfort*.
book.spectrum.guidebook.pigment.page13.t:
This bright, vibrant cotton candy pink makes me beam with joy.\
\
[#](d6658f)Pink[#]() represents *Health* and *Admiration*.
book.spectrum.guidebook.pigment.page14.t:
This sight gets my mind going. It not only stimulates my thirst for knowledge, but also sparks creative ideas.\
\
[#](ff4ff6)Purple[#]() represents *Wisdom* and *Creativity*.
book.spectrum.guidebook.pigment.page15.t:
I feel the urge and desire to create something beautiful.\
\
[#](8f2121)Red[#]() represents *Passion* and *Willpower*.
book.spectrum.guidebook.pigment.page16.t:
I cannot put it into words exactly. Staggering, overwhelming, but in a good way. There is something unspeakably wonderful about this Pigment.\
\
[#](d0d6d7)White[#]() represents *LIFE*, *Light* and *Purity*.
book.spectrum.guidebook.pigment.page17.t:
The vibrant yellow is almost bursting with energy.\
\
[#](eded00)Yellow[#]() represents *Energy* and *Joy*.
book.spectrum.guidebook.pigment.page18.t: I can always craft them back into [#](bb00bb)Pigment[#]().
book.spectrum.guidebook.pigment.page2.te:
The darkest material I have ever held in my hands. It looks almost surreal.\
\
[#](302951)Black[#]() represents the nothingness of the *Void*, *Power* and *Mystery*.
book.spectrum.guidebook.pigment.page3.te:
Holding it in my hand gives me a sense of security. All nonsense of course, after all, it is only a color. But still...\
\
[#](2c2e8e)Blue[#]() represents *Safety* and *Permanence*.
book.spectrum.guidebook.pigment.page4.te:
This rich brown makes me long for mother nature.\
\
[#](613c20)Brown[#]() represents *Nature* and *Stability*.
book.spectrum.guidebook.pigment.page5.te:
Makes me feel like I am sitting on the top of a mountain, taking in the infinite vastness of this world.\
\
[#](5bffed)Cyan[#]() represents *Matter* and *Integrity*.
book.spectrum.guidebook.pigment.page6.te:
This color looks to me like the defeated older brother of light gray. Looking at it makes me a little sad, but I am not sure why exactly.\
\
[#](36393d)Gray[#]() represents *Evanescence*.
book.spectrum.guidebook.pigment.page7.te:
This Pigment gently radiates inner peace.\
\
[#](495b24)Green[#]() represents *Balance* and *Harmony*.
book.spectrum.guidebook.pigment.page8.te:
I feel a sense of optimism, but also of departure.\
\
[#](258ac8)Light Blue[#]() represents *Luck* and *Peace*.
book.spectrum.guidebook.pigment.page9.te:
Do you know the feeling of sitting serenely, looking at the landscape, feeling life pass you by, and yet everything is okay?\
\
[#](7d7d73)Light Gray[#]() represents *Change*, but also *Quiet*.
Carrying enough [Ink](entry://ink/ink) to maintain my magical equipment has become both a chore and a space hog in my inventory.\
It's time for a new creation: the Pigment Palette.\
\
*Thematically fitting, isn't it? Now I feel like a real Artist.*
Capable of storing sizable amounts of [Ink](entry://ink/ink), perfect for powering all my magical equipment. Unable to power machines, though.
[Moonstone Cores](entry://dimension/moonstone_cores) burst with energy. It sounds like a very bad idea to discharge one in milliseconds.\
\
*...but sometimes the worst ideas are the best, aren't they?*\
\
Their explosion does not damage blocks, but causes [enormously aggressive fire](entry://dimension/primordial_fire).
I know people who build gigantic constructions out of [#](bb00bb)Redstone[#]() just to open an oversized door. And then they trigger it with an unsightly [#](bb00bb)Pressure Plate[#]().\
The Player Detector, on the other hand, is able to sense my presence - or that of other players - from a distance and sends out an appropriate [#](449900)redstone signal[#]().\
*Much prettier*.

Radius of 10 blocks.\
Emits a full strength signal, if the player who placed it is detected, otherwise 8.
book.spectrum.guidebook.potion_workshop_: Workshop Crafting
book.spectrum.guidebook.preenchanted_too:
That stupid obsidian table is very stubborn when it comes to giving you the enchantments you seek.\
Besides, you'd either have to slaughter a whole herd of cows or rob the books of a dozen villages (no wonder the inhabitants there are so stupid and only too happy to be eaten by Zombies).

The advantage of knowing exactly what you want gives you the ability to shape your tools so that they inherently possess those qualities. The magic of colors makes it possible.\
\
Unfortunately, these features make these tools very fragile for the most part.

The ends of this pickaxe are studded with Topaz to cut even the most delicate material from stone.\
Pre-enchanted with **[#](157687)Silk Touch[#]()**.

Infused with the power of [#](f0af15)energy[#](), it allows you to carve out every last bit of ore from every vein.\
Pre-enchanted with **[#](f0af15)Fortune III[#]()**.

The short, razor-sharp blade makes this item a deadly weapon - but at the cost of durability.\
Pre-enchanted with **[#](aa32a0)Looting III[#]()**.
As an outlier in the group, the Oblivion Pickaxe has a large amount of durability and mining speed. However, all mined blocks [are destroyed](entry://enchanting/enchantments/curse_of_the_void)[#]().
Matches its own gentle vibrations to those of its surroundings. [Allows you to keep blocks intact](entry://enchanting/enchantments/resonance) that would otherwise be irreparably destroyed.

A real Powerhouse of a Pickaxe for when you want to break hard blocks.\
Comes pre-enchanted with [Razing](entry://enchanting/enchantments/razing).
book.spectrum.guidebook.present.page0.te:
The people around me have helped me through some tough situations. It's about time I give something back. A dash of [Shimmerstone](entry://general/shimmerstone) causes the package to explode in a colorful shower of particles.\
After I click the Present onto the items I want to gift, I have to wrap it and then set it down so the recipient can open it and I can watch them jump for joy.
book.spectrum.guidebook.present.page1.te:
*(Or, you know, I can always gift my future self!)*\
\
Some items have special behavior when unwrapped.
book.spectrum.guidebook.present.page2.te:
- Put filled Present in crafting grid to wrap
- Optional: add [Pigment](entry://general/pigment) for a colorful particle shower
- Optional: add a special item to choose a wrapping paper:
- Red Dye: Red
- Blue Dye: Blue
book.spectrum.guidebook.present.page3.te:
- Cyan Dye: Cyan
- Green Dye: Green
- Purple Dye: Purple
- Cake: Cake
- Flower: Stripes
- Firework Star: Starry
- Snowball: Winter
- Spore Blossom: Rainbow
book.spectrum.guidebook.preservation_rui:
Deep underground I found this outlandish structure, which seems to be made of immensely sturdy stone. Whoever built it seems to have knowledge far beyond my understanding.\
There must be a way to get in there! If not now, then later... better keep the location in mind.

Until now, I thought I was alone in my creative endeavours. It seems I was wrong. So very, very wrong.\
Whoever built these structures obviously followed a similar path to mine, but was miles ahead.\
Still, anyways. I accept the challenge, of course. I have one huge advantage:\
*I am still alive.*
These structures seem to come in different variations. In each one I seem to encounter a different challenge.
A powerful, magical force field. Wearing [Azure Dike equipment](entry://equipment/trinkets/azure_dike_equipment) allowed me to enter.
It was all so clear in the end! I had it [all figured out already](entry://general/color_mixing).
A really weird one. Having some colors on hand helped a lot.
book.spectrum.guidebook.primordial_light:
[Primordial Fire](entry://dimension/primordial_fire)[#]() is the devil's stuff. No wonder it eats away at your soul.\
\
Without this glove, I would be very uncomfortable. - *I actually quite like my soul*.
book.spectrum.guidebook.provider_node.pa:
Make the items in the connected inventory available in their [Pastel Network](entry://pastel_network/pastel_network).\
\
Items are not pushed, but can be requested from [Gather Nodes](entry://pastel_network/gather_node).
book.spectrum.guidebook.puff_circlet.pag:
This glistening hoop creates a protective film of air around you.\
\
Grants you [#](495b24)4[#]() points of [#](2c2e8e)Azure Dike[#](). Using those charges, it not only protects you from enemy projectiles, but can even cushion a long fall.\
The Puff Circlet also prevents [#](bb00bb)Farmland[#]() from being trampled.
*Gone are the days of being sniped from behind by Skeletons.*
book.spectrum.guidebook.pure_resources.p:
Growing materials in the [Crystallarieum](entry://ink/crystallarieum) has yielded this: a much purer, crystalline variant compared to [#](bb00bb)Raw Ore[#]().\
\
On closer inspection they almost appear to be surrounded by an almost invisible sheen, gently protecting them from the elements. This shroud seems to be what protects [#](bb00bb)Pure Copper[#]() from oxidation.
Ironically, I found that this same sheen also seems to make them withstand the heat of [#](bb00bb)Furnaces[#](). A [#](bb00bb)Blast Furnace[#]() did the job (poorly, but it did!).
Smelting these in the [Cinderhearth](entry://ink/cinderhearth) will give me a much more decent output.
Can be crafted back into the corresponding [#](bb00bb)Pure Resource[#]().
It doesn't get much more efficient or risk-free than that.
book.spectrum.guidebook.quitoxic_reeds.p: Grows exclusively in Swamps and [#](bb00bb)seems to devour Clay[#]() as a form of nutrient.

I was able to extract a purple glittering powder from the stems of this alien-looking plant by [crushing it](entry://general/item_crushing)!\
The smell and consistency are very unusual when rubbed between my fingers.\
\
*...wait a moment, what are fingers?*
book.spectrum.guidebook.radiance_pin.pag:
You didn't name the Radiance so similar to the [Radiance Staff](entry://equipment/radiance_staff) on accident.\
If you are in a dark area, the pin automatically creates an invisible light on you. Unlike the lights of the [Radiance Staff](entry://equipment/radiance_staff), however, they slowly become fainter and fainter until they eventually dissipate completely.
Fantastic to see the paths you've already taken in your cave explorations.
book.spectrum.guidebook.radiance_staff.p:
Torches have one crucial weakness: I have to get into the dark, before placing them. In contrast, the Radiance Staff's Light Flood ability can place lights far away and in the air, illuminating large caverns from afar.\
As a final goodie, these lights are invisible, making them great for lighting my builds atmospherically.

Right-clicking placed lights with the staff to adjust the light level.\
They can even be summoned underwater.
Those pesky Endermen!\
\
They always come out at night and steal blocks off the ground right in front of my house. I have a feeling this whole area will be nothing but a crater in a month.

The Endermen come to this world to place down these blocks. *What is this stuff*? And *WHY* are they leaving them here?\
\
Now that I hold one in my hands... they are everywhere! How didn't I notice earlier? Anyway, I'm sure that I can make use of this interesting material somehow.
book.spectrum.guidebook.rare_intact_gem: Rarely, I can carve out an intact gem, that I can use in recipes for which fragments are too small. With some effort, these fragments can also be made whole again.
book.spectrum.guidebook.redstone_calcula: Using the red math dust from underground, I've built gigantic constructions several times, just to emulate a parrot's ability to calculate. When I look at them, my breath literally stops (*and the rest of the world, too, several times a second*). The energy-laden [Citrine](entry://general/shards@citrine) seems perfect for cramming basic arithmetic logic into a very small space.
Available modes: Addition, Subtraction, Multiplication, Division, Modulo, Min and Max. First input is the back, second is the highest signal on the sides.
book.spectrum.guidebook.redstone_interac: When I expose a [#](bb00bb)Pastel Node[#]() to a [#](449900)redstone signal[#](), it loses the link to its attached inventory.

- [Gather Nodes](entry://pastel_network/gather_node) will stop requesting items
- [Provider Nodes](entry://pastel_network/provider_node) will be unable to offer their items
- [Sender Nodes](entry://pastel_network/sender_node) will stop emptying their inventory
- [Storage Nodes](entry://pastel_network/storage_node) will be unable to accept and offer their items
book.spectrum.guidebook.redstone_sand.pa:
Thinking back to the good old days when I would set little traps for my friends: if they touched the wrong block, they would be completely buried in sand. Today my friends are not so easily fooled anymore.\
\
Modern problems require modern solutions.
Behaves like a solid block until it receives a [#](449900)redstone signal[#](). The [#](449900)redstone pulse[#]() propagates through all connected blocks, causing them to fall.
book.spectrum.guidebook.redstone_timer.p: While there are many ways to calculate time, most of them seem relatively... rustic. They are no match for this new trick up my sleeve: the time affinity of [Amethyst Shards](entry://general/shards@amethyst).
I can toggle the duration of both the active time (interacting) and the inactive time (sneak-interacting with empty hands).
book.spectrum.guidebook.redstone_transce:
Gentle resonances are amplified by [Onyx](entry://general/shards@onyx) to such an extent that they can be measured even through walls, given a suitable receiver.\
Based on my previous experiments with [Gemstone Shards](entry://general/shards), it was easy for me to devise such transmitter and receiver system.
Using it with empty hands toggles between sending and receiving. In receive mode the output is directional. The frequency can be changed with Dye/Pigment/Paintbrush. Range: 16 blocks.
book.spectrum.guidebook.resonance_harves: Tools enchanted with [Resonance](entry://enchanting/enchantments/resonance) are able to harvest [#](bb00bb)Budding Blocks[#]().
Mining is your game. It's almost a miracle that you're only now coming up with the idea of upgrading not only your tools, but your mining proficiency in general. This ring will grow with your abilities.
Infuse it with [Magenta Ink](entry://ink/ink) in a [Color Picker](entry://ink/color_picker)[#]() to increase your Mining Speed.
book.spectrum.guidebook.semi_permeable_g:
Those pesky monsters that appear at night have long since ceased to be a threat to me, now merely serving as a resource supplier, if anything. But that doesn't stop them from stalking and harassing me.\
I've spent more time keeping those pesky monsters out of my base than I care to admit.

Then I remembered my [Gemstone Glass recipe](entry://decoration/gemstone_glass) that I had created earlier.\
\
With a bit of magical energy, it was no problem to make it not only transparent, but also passable for me (but not for them!).\
\
Bonus: I made it look exactly like regular glass in case I want to fool my competitors.
Alrhough it looks exactly like its [mundane counterpart](entry://decoration/gemstone_glass), only players can pass through it. All other creatures will bounce off it like a fly off a window.
Comes in all gemstone colors and a few more.
book.spectrum.guidebook.sender_node.name: Sender Node
book.spectrum.guidebook.sender_node.page:
The Sender Node will actively try to keep the connected inventory empty.\
\
The order, in which it will push items, is as follows:
1. [Gather Nodes](entry://pastel_network/gather_node)
2. [Storage Nodes](entry://pastel_network/storage_node)
book.spectrum.guidebook.seven_league_boo: Getting from A to B is tedious. Your travel time only seems to go up, especially with [Geodes](entry://general/geodes) scattered across the land as they are. To solve this issue, you designed the Seven League Boots, making you much more mobile than before.
Increases both Movement Speed and Step Height.
The Power enchantment increases the movement speed bonus further.
book.spectrum.guidebook.shards.name: Gemstone Shards
book.spectrum.guidebook.shards.page0.tex:
In a [geode](entry://general/geodes) I found this interesting gemstone. Not an item like every other for sure. This one (and other ones?) are special.\
\
Each type of gem represents both an elemental color and a natural force.
book.spectrum.guidebook.shards.page1.tex:
Topaz Shards are surprisingly heavy in my hand. This gemstone quickly proved to be one of the most robust materials I've ever handled - perhaps only surpassed by diamond. I found Topaz in geodes at the very tops of steep hills and on the summits of sky-high mountains.\
The Topaz represents **[#](5bffed)MATTER.[#]()**
book.spectrum.guidebook.shards.page2.tex:
Magenta light is refracted in this gemstone.\
Formed over eons in the geodes, this gem radiates awe. I found this symbol of permanence in the deepest layers of the world.\
\
The Amethyst represents **[#](ff4ff6)TIME[#]()**.
book.spectrum.guidebook.shards.page3.tex:
I stumbled upon this yellow gemstone near the surface level where the sun's light dissipates into warmth.\
\
Its bright yellow luster radiates pure **[#](eded00)ENERGY[#]()** and makes it slightly warm to the touch at all times.
book.spectrum.guidebook.shards.page4.tex:
Onyx is almost pitch black. It almost seems to sap the light from its surroundings.\
\
Onyx, the combination of energy, matter, and time, serves great as a focus and **[#](302951)CATALYST[#]()** for my magical tools and devices.
book.spectrum.guidebook.shards.page5.tex:
Its white glow reminds me of the soothing light of the moon on a cool summer night. The tranquillity it exudes leaves a calming yet significant impression, like a sleeping cat - balm for the soul and yet a predator, always on guard.\
\
The Moonstone embodies **[#](d0d6d7)PURITY[#]()**.
book.spectrum.guidebook.shimmerstone.pag:
A yellow ore that not only emits energy in the form of light, but can also manipulate it.\
\
I found Shimmerstone Ore near sea level and further up.
Full blocks of Shimmerstone emit glowing bright yellow particles.
book.spectrum.guidebook.sleep_resistance: This brew is a work of elemental night alchemy and works off of velvet magic. It is thus affected by the mental constitution of the afflicted, and in my own case, sleep resistance.
book.spectrum.guidebook.staff_of_remembr:
*One to rule them all*\
...well, politely, of course.\
\
The Staff of Remembrance allows me to move around my animals with ease, over both short and long distances.
Tapping animals recollects them into a [Memory](entry://creating_life/memories).
book.spectrum.guidebook.stargazing.name: Stargazing
book.spectrum.guidebook.stargazing.page0: The calmness of the night often invites me to lie in the grass and watch the stars.
book.spectrum.guidebook.stargazing.page1:
The small Shooting Stars are made of a material unknown to me thus far.\
\
Can I catch one right out of the sky?\
\
*I am sure they are even easier to spot when I am using a Telescope or Night Vision.*
book.spectrum.guidebook.stargazing.page2:
Now that I've collected all variants, it's time to unwind! Hardened with a Diamond a stars won't anymore when hit.\
\
*Fancy a Starball tournament with friends?*
book.spectrum.guidebook.stargazing.page3:
Shooting Stars yield valuable resources: a Star Fragment, Stardust and a variety of other rare materials.\
\
Picking up a Shooting Star by crouching and [crushing it with an Anvil](entry://general/item_crushing) will yield double the Star Fragments, albeit at the cost of the other loot.
book.spectrum.guidebook.stargazing.page4:
A powder of unknown origin blessed with the soul of the stars.\
Bears coy, yet latent power.
book.spectrum.guidebook.storage_node.pag:
The Storage Node shows its greatest use in combination with [Sender Nodes](entry://pastel_network/sender_node) (will push to it) and [Gather Nodes](entry://pastel_network/gather_node) (will pull from it).\
\
Its [#](449900)filter[#]() allows me to specify which items it will receive & provide. An empty filter makes the connected inventory act as a general store for all types of items.
book.spectrum.guidebook.storm_stones.pag:
Storms are a powerful manifestation of Mother Nature.\
Using the [Fusion Shrine](entry://general/fusion_shrine) I even started one while I was crafting [some powerful resources](entry://general/onyx_shards).\
\
There is no doubt that I will find something related to them that can help me on my journey.

Dug into the ground by lightning strikes, I found these stones, vibrating in my hand with barely contained energy.\
Used in the [Fusion Shrine](entry://general/fusion_shrine), I can summon another thunderstorm with ease.\
\
*Because of their volatile nature, they don't react too well to explosions...*
book.spectrum.guidebook.stratine.name: Stratine
book.spectrum.guidebook.stratine.page0.t:
This very heavy ore is scattered throughout the depths of the Nether.\
It is probably not the best idea to carry large amounts of it home at once.
book.spectrum.guidebook.stratine.page2.t:
Stratine - as I already discovered - is an exceptionally heavy material. And difficult to shape. Even the blazing heat of the Nether did it no harm.\
\
However, shaping it with my [Pedestal](entry://general/pedestal) should be no problem at all.
book.spectrum.guidebook.take_off_belt.pa:
Climbing mountains or misshapen caves is always very time-consuming. If you don't see an option to scramble up over misshapen ledges, you have no choice but to carve a path into the rock.\
Using your new Takeoff Belt you are able to put great vertical distances behind you, saving time and sparing your beautiful nature from destruction.

Sneak to charge a high jump, getting more powerful the longer you charge.\
\
*Even if the name implies it, please don't take it off.*
The Power enchantment increases the jump height even further.

Feather Falling will grant you a short slow fall effect, allowing you to better navigate to where you want to land. A high level of Feather Falling may be a very viable way to safely descend down those cliffs again, actually.
book.spectrum.guidebook.totem_pendant.pa:
[#](bb00bb)Totems of Undying[#](), while having a powerful effect, have the significant disadvantage that you always have to hold them in your hand.\
\
Using the protective powers of [Blue Pigment](entry://general/pigment@blue) as a focus you can keep its life-saving effect active, even when worn around the neck.
One-time protection from death. After it is triggered, crumbles into dust.
book.spectrum.guidebook.turn_back_to_pol: By applying heat, all blocks can be returned to their polished state.
book.spectrum.guidebook.universe_spyhole:
The creations that [Radiating Ender](entry://general/radiating_ender)* allows me to create never cease to amaze me.\
\
Placed directly on a wall or on the ground, this strange block allows me to glimpse the other side, allowing me to discover cave systems and structures... or see the sky if I am underground!
*I now see what you did there*
book.spectrum.guidebook.upgrades.name: Structure Upgrades
book.spectrum.guidebook.upgrades.page0.t:
The Pigment Pedestal and Fusion Shrine have already proven their worth. But there is always room for improvement. That's why I've created these upgrades. Each one improves the properties of my structures in a different way.\
Additional upgrades of the same type have a reduced effect.
book.spectrum.guidebook.upgrades.page1.t: Crafting times have increased a lot recently, mostly due to the use of more complex components. This will help me bring the times back to an acceptable level.
book.spectrum.guidebook.upgrades.page2.t: The Pedestal Accelerator T2 improves on its predecessor. Making crafting even more fast.
book.spectrum.guidebook.upgrades.page3.t: Tier 3 leaves nothing to be desired - at least in terms of crafting speed.
book.spectrum.guidebook.upgrades.page4.t: Most of the time, the experience gained from crafting is pretty much negligible. But with this Focus I can dramatically increase the amount I get.
book.spectrum.guidebook.upgrades.page5.t: This improved Knowledge Focus increases crafting XP even more.
book.spectrum.guidebook.upgrades.page6.t: Allows me to cushion the consumption of my structures a little.
book.spectrum.guidebook.upgrades.page7.t: This 'upgrade of the upgrade' further reduces the use use of input materials.
book.spectrum.guidebook.upgrades.page8.t:
Although the chance is very small, I can increase the results from crafting!\
*More bang for my buck!*
book.spectrum.guidebook.upgrades.page9.t: This upgraded version is much more powerful and has an even higher chance of increasing crafting output.
book.spectrum.guidebook.use_in_potion_wo:
Use the [Potion Workshop](entry://brewing/potion_workshop) to infuse it, by placing it where the [#](bb00bb)Bottle[#]() would normally go.\
\
To clear its effect, put it in a crafting grid.
book.spectrum.guidebook.vanilla.name: Mundane Items
book.spectrum.guidebook.vanilla.page0.te: There are a few items that have always been difficult or even impossible to craft. My new skills make that *much* easier.
book.spectrum.guidebook.weather_detector:
Citrine is very sensitive to the energies released during a storm.\
\
When exposed to rain or a thunderstorm, it emits a [#](449900)redstone signal[#]().
Rain will give a strength 8 signal, thunderstorms a full 15.
These hostile underwater temples are hell to maneuver in. Luckily, in your search for treasure, you stumbled upon a [#](bb00bb)Heart of The Sea[#]().\
This circlet allows you to live and mine underwater as if it were the most natural thing ever. You swim and mine faster, require no air and are able to see better.\
It also heals your little close by Axolotl friends. ♥

*Have you ever wanted to live underwater?\
No? Whatever, now you can. Time to build an underwater base!*
book.spectrum.guidebook.what_happened.pa:
*Tracing the history of the Deeper Down*.\
\
There is no doubt that, despite the lack of light, there must once have been a highly advanced civilisation down here. But all I have found are ruins.\
What happened? Surely I can find clues to their whereabouts. Demise? Legacy?
Is there a place I have not searched yet?
Now that Bedrock is no longer the bottom, *what* is there?
How were the ruins I found in the Overworld created?
How did the Black Langast come about?
Those bones in the Dragonrot Swamps... can they be broken?
What about those strange Crystals in the Crystal Gardens?
Can I find Geodes around here, too?
I searched far and wide for a place that I might could have missed. But no matter where I looked, there was not a single soul in sight.
Clue: Biomes
It's like turtles all the way down, isn't it? Until a moment ago I thought Bedrock was indestructible, an here I am. Unbreakable? Possibly. For now, at least.
Clue: Dimension Floor

Apparently Downstone was not completely indestructible to the previous inhabitants? It took immense, high-tech constructs, but they were able to process the stone and refine it into what I call "Preservation Stone".
Clue: Excavation Sites
The remains growing in [Black Langast](entry://dimension/black_langast) were actually Resonant Lilies, once. What happened here? Does this mean...
Clue: Black Langast

I keep coming across gigantic skeletons. Whether they were really dragons is still written in the stars, but whatever they were, they were certainly powerful. Did they wipe out the inhabitants and then somehow meet their own end?
Clue: Dragonbone
Literally humming stones with a lot of indwelling energy. When interacted with, they shake each other until they shatter wihout any further external influence. Usable as energy source?
Clue: Hummingstone
The dazzling white geodes down here are unlike any I have seen before, and hold immense magical power. But why do they only exist here? More questions...
Clue: Moonstone
book.spectrum.guidebook.whispy_circlet.p:
The bags under your eyes aren't the only evidence of your lack of sleep. There are those creatures that come haunt you straight out of your missed nightmares when you don't regularly lay down to sleep - almost like they feel cheated.\
The manifestation of relaxation, no sleep necessary.

After just a few minutes of wear, you feel physically and mentally refreshed. You also recover from negative effects more quickly.\
\
*The pleasures of a good night's sleep.*

effect.spectrum.ascension.desc: The call of heaven, or something like that. A glorious, gathering of forces before Divinity kicks in.
effect.spectrum.calming.desc: Reduces enemy spawn rates and aggression.
effect.spectrum.density.desc: Makes you heavier, preventing you from making long jumps and increasing fall damage taken.
effect.spectrum.divinity.desc: Grants massive buffs... at great cost, should you die.
effect.spectrum.effect_prolonging.desc: Increases the duration of other status effects applied to you.
effect.spectrum.eternal_slumber.desc: Locks the target into a deep, dreamless sleep, from which few can escape.
effect.spectrum.fatal_slumber.desc: Induces instant death upon timing out.
effect.spectrum.frenzy.desc: Buffs damage, attack speed, movement speed, and knockback resistance with each kill. Not scoring a kill in 10 seconds will debuff you instead.
effect.spectrum.immunity.desc: Removes all negative status effects, and prevents you from getting new ones.
effect.spectrum.lava_gliding.desc: Increases your movement speed and visibility in Lava. Does not provide Fire Resistance, however
effect.spectrum.lightweight.desc: Makes you lighter, increasing jump height, slowing falls, and at high levels granting immunity to fall damage.
effect.spectrum.magic_annulation.desc: Reduces incoming magic damage by 1 point per level.
effect.spectrum.projectile_rebound.desc: Grants a small chance to defend against incoming projectiles.
effect.spectrum.scarred.desc: Stops natural health regeneration and prevents you from sprinting.
effect.spectrum.somnolence.desc: Causes intense fatigue, but allows sleeping through the day.
enchantment.spectrum.big_catch.desc: Higher chance to reel in living creatures
enchantment.spectrum.inexorable.desc: Prevents tool and movement slowdown effects
enchantment.spectrum.razing.desc: Higher mining speed the harder a block is to break
enchantment.spectrum.serendipity_reel.de: Chance to reel in double loot
